The rooms are equipped with an LCD flatscreen TV and basic cable, wireless or wired Internet, a coffee machine, small fridge and an iron. That's about it, the bathroom is very basic and the shower is of the old fixed head type so pretty unremarkable. In general this is an obvious attempt to charge boutique hotel rates for nothing more than basic motel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: azazzi
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff who made you feel like you were staying at their home. The location is GREAT! All kinds of food and shopping within walking distance. My wife and I got some ice cream and rode the trolly back and forth at the grove.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Lynnem82
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay while I was in LA. The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient and as someone getting around on foot or public transport, I loved that right across the street were already some great places to visit - the Grove and the Farmer's Market as well as bus stops within seconds walk from the hotel. My room was lovely, very clean, spacious and I actually really liked the chair. I could have slept in it, it was so comfy. I was unwell at the beginning of my stay so I spent a good bit of time in my room and it was a great place to recuperate. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler10201
Reviews.Content: they will try and rip you off, read your invoice before you check out. this hotel needs new management and staff. they were not nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and great location in LA.”
Reviews.Author: barrylisa
Reviews.Content: We picked the Farmers Daughter due to other trip advisor ratings and we were not disappointed. The location was great, rooms had everything you needed, bed was comfortable and room was quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definately stay there again if we go to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facility and service- would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: hornedfrog2011
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Hollywood. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, the hotel is located right across from the Farmer's Market and the Grove. Sunset Blvd and other great places to eat are close by. The staff was helpful and friendly. Never had difficulty parking, except it is a $17 fee per day for valet, which is the only option if you have a car. The overall price of the hotel is hard to beat in this area. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wayyyyyy overpriced for Quality”
Reviews.Author: Melissa10_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location if you want to be close to CBS studios. Farmers Market is across the street. And I guess it is in a central location to other area attractions. However, it should be a lot nicer for the price, you shouldn't have to pay that much for location. It should have been half the cost. The hotel clerks did hold our bags while we toured the city, due to the fact that we knew we didn't want to stay there again. The worst part was the awful advice we were given from hotel staff. They advised us to go to Venice Beach next and stay there, that was ghetto for us. But that is another review. If you are willing to pay $250, then find something on sunset or pay a little more for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again - parts good, but rude and not great value”
Reviews.Author: BizTrav30
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel, but the fact that I am writing my first review on it says something. I had one of the most unpleasant experiences that I have ever had in staying hotels anywhere around the world. On the whole the service was good. But in one day the manager - who seems to respond to posts on here - was able to destroy all of that good will. Having taken one payment off my card successfully, the manager wanted to immediately authorise a future transaction in advance but the card declined it - presumably as I was abroad (I had informed the bank) and the fact that the same place was running a second amount through within seconds. I reiterate, the first payment for several days stay WENT THROUGH NO PROBS. The manager didn't try to be helpful or understanding. Instead he was aggressive and deeply rude from the moment he first spoke to me. If I didn't have a thicker skin it would have been very embarrassing, as there were other people in the foyer. He said he would lock the room and wouldn't let me back in until I had a valid card (said cards were in my room and I couldn't call the bank as it was 1am in the UK). I wanted to get back into the room to use another card or my internet banking - he said he would only allow that if he came with me and sat with me whilst I accessed my account. As a professional person traveling with work I was made to feel like a child. I should add that I was staying for another week at this point. Once we managed to sort it, he asked if he could buy us a drink. Really quite a strange way to run a hotel - I didn't want a drink, just some common courtesy and politeness that should be run of the mill to a hotel guest. As this was going on we saw the same manager interact with another guest who had merely come to ask for a street map. And he was equally unpleasant and unhelpful in his dealing with this man, who in the end said 'You know what, forget it, I'll sort it out myself'. The final thing that really upset me with this hotel was the tiny bird cage in the foyer that housed two budgies. I really am no EcoWarrior type, but if there's something that upsets me it's seeing birds in a cage. Now that's my beef and it might not bother you. But what did concern me though was that one of the poor birds had a very long beak that had overgrown, it was clearly in distress - its partner was having to feed it. For God's sake, ignore my comments about the management but please take your sick bird to the vet! Regarding the rest of the place, it's a great location. The rest of the staff, bar one other, were really friendly. The manager should take lessons from the two girls on the desk. Tart serves some good fodder. BUT it is definitely overpriced. As other people say, the decor is tired. I can see what they're trying to achieve, but rather than being a pastiche design finished to a high standard, it's a redecorate done on the cheap with a marketing spin on the skimped finish. On a point of principal I wouldn't stay here. But also from an objective perspective I still wouldn't stay here - there are better boutique hotels in this price range. I'd go to the W Hotel, Sunset or Standard next time, even if it meant paying a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Really cozy, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: emiemi_715
Reviews.Content: Close to the Grove, and Farmer's Market that has lots of shopping and good food. Cozy hotel, modern and chic.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and funky”
Reviews.Author: Cockneyrose
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel close to most sights. Still alot of walking involved and found it best to take a taxi. Great staff. Super clean. Great beds but pillows lumpy. Excellent restuarant on site.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Location, AWESOME Service, ADORABLE Style”
Reviews.Author: awest4806
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (late 20's, early 30's) totally enjoyed our stay at The Farmer's Daughter! This hotel is not your normal high rise, it only has 3 stories and it's definitely far away from the hotel chain standard. It's quaint decor is shabby chic and if you're looking for luxury, you won't find it here, however if you're looking for a FANTASTIC location, AWESOME service, and ADORABLE style then The Farmer's Daughter will be just as perfect for you as it was for us! The staff is super helpful with printing maps, making reservations...etc and will be more than able to answer any of your traveling questions! The rooms were fairly quiet and we enjoyed the renovated motel to hotel. I will most certainly stay here again and recommend this to anyone who is a Price Is Right hopeful or looking to lots of shopping/eating at The Grove! My husband and I were able to do everything on our list from this great location and we look forward to our next stay here!

Reviews.Title: “After you reserve online, you can't cancel, no refund. Just like a trap.”
Reviews.Author: CJL63
Reviews.Content: i reserved two nights, online, then i cancel one night and actually stay one night. Later when i back to home, i receive two nights charge from VISA. All the system emails indicated that the cancellation is done correctly. Couple of calls and emails, then I got the reply that online reservation can't be canceled, or can be canceled online but no refund (my cancellation was two weeks ahead). I live at Asia so online reservation is easier for me, but i think even for people live in States are also used to online reservation. If that is a pre-paid without refund, it shall show clearly at final step (or any step) that this operation is "not refundable". The system did have this information but in separate "term and condition" or not-obvious position. The manager refuse to admit any fault they might have. the online reservation system is just like a trap.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: rimrem
Reviews.Content: Good location within walking distance to the Grove/Farmer's Market. Hotel is a renovated low-rise motel-like building. Rooms are clean and fairly basic in its own quirky farm theme. Given its price, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small family run hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: walshy123456
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great postion for resturants shops and all attractions. Opposite the Farmers market, the streets are paved with beautiful resturants and bars. After a long day of visiting all the obvious things to do around L.A. its nice all you have to do is walk accross the road for everything you need, including shops. The sidewalks all have piped music. I have been to L.A. several times and i know at night time it's sometimes hard to find places to go without having to get cabs etc. There were 4 of us and we had a ball. Its clean, friendly and a nice cafe and bar. in one word fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its quirky but a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sundae1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in July. The hotel was quirky with its theme and set up but good value. The staff are great, and they make the hotel feel very relaxed. Agree that the rooms are fairly basic in a motel style but its really a place to sleep only so did not worry us at all. Only suggestion is that the restaurant open on Sunday nights... We will definitely stay at farmers market again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUV2Travel000
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here over the Canadian August Long weekend. I was very impressed with the front desk staff-in particular Lewis. He went out of his way to make sure that we found all the places we wanted to see. The rooms were great and so cute! The restaurant TART was also really great and we were really impressed with the service there as well. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: KariFaith
Reviews.Content: The Farmers Daughter is not a 5 star hotel, so don't expect it to be luxurious. Here is what you can expect. A great clean room and bathroom. Extremely friendly and accomidating staff, a delicious restaruant right down stairs. The most central location in a city that is hard to get around and all for a great price. We would absolutley stay there again and we travelled wtih our 9 month old and they were able to give us everything we needed, cripb, high chair, and two little birds in the lobby for him to look at!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CJP52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Farmer's Daughter because of the location and proximity to our daughter who lives nearby. We were well pleased with the location, and proximity to the Farmer's Market, which is a jewel to be experienced in L.A. Hotel was clean, simple, well managed. The location was awesome. Nothing fancy, but adequate. The attached restaurant had excellent breakfast, in fact, the food was better than at "Toast", out daughter's favorite breakfast place. The draperies need to be thicker, to block out the "city lights"... our room faced a giant billboard that was very bright. Otherwise, we were well pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: janet795
Reviews.Content: I Love this hotel.. It is very convienent to the Grove as it is right across the street from all the shopping and the Farmers market. You can park your car and walk to all the shopping and restaurants. It is quaint and really no frills but so clean and the staff is very friendly. I love the restaurant, Tart, but $4.00 for a cup of tea was a little crazy. I have stayed there everytime I am in LA and plan on staying again shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vag1047
Reviews.Content: Small convenient hotel, nothing fancy. Staff is the best part of this place, they always had a smile and seemed happy we were staying there. Location was great for me, walking distance to CBS, Farmers Market!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & cute hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: marzy000
Reviews.Content: I stopped off in LA by myself at the end of a business trip and so was looking for a hotel that was walking distance to some sights / restarants (as I don't drive in the US) and was in a safe area. This was an excellent choice! The hotel is across the road from The Farmer's Market and The Grove Mall with shopping, cinema, and loads of restaurant and takeaway food. It's also 15 mins walk from Melrose Avenue, and the hop-on-hop-off bus tops at the Grove and Melrose Avenue which was really handy. The room itself was clean and comfy, and the theme was really cute. My bed was super comfy and I slept very well, although my room was right outside from the ice machine which did wake me up a few times - but that type of thing doesn't normally worry me. Also, everything I ate at Tart Restaurant was delicious and very good value. Can't rave enouh about The Farmer's Daughter and Tart!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Deal”
Reviews.Author: ivanuf
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a suite with the kids (6 and 11). The Hotel is great, the staff is also great. The location close to all your hollywood attractions and across the street from Farmers Market and CBS studios. The kids used a sofa bed that the staff prepared for them everyday and they had their own TV. The room has a small kitchen (no microwave) but they do have a small stove for heating (Farmers style), it also has a fridge. The bath was spacious and the water and bath products were excellent. The only thing to note will be that the Air conditioner was located on the main room and it took a while to cool the bedroom, but once it was cooled it was fine. Also with kids in the next room, you really have no privacy because the master room does not have a door lock and if you close the door you loose the AC. And the only two recommendation I can make to the hotel is to get better pillows, for me it makes a huge difference on a good night sleep, and the pillows were the only thing I can nip pick out of a great stay experience and the second one is to heat the pool. The pool area is only for sun bathing, our kids wanted to spend a day relaxing in the hotel, but the pool water was too cold for them.

Reviews.Title: “love it. cute with a really happy vibe.”
Reviews.Author: sussexhamster
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? Big room, cosy armchair, view of the hollywood sign (once you know where to look), nice people, good location, nice toiletries, good restaurant on site, just opposite farmer's market (which is great for breakfast) and the Grove shops (which are great if you like showtunes and fountains!). Thoughtful little touches, like the fresh lemonade at reception really make a difference. There's just a really happy vibe to the place, and i'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A cute gem in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Thebeans13
Reviews.Content: Location was paramount........................and while this hotel is not luxury per se, it was immaculate, kitchy and the staff terrific -- friendly,helpful and efficient. It's within walking distance of the Beverly Center, the Grove, LA County Museum and LaBrea Tar Pits as well as some nice local shopping and dining areas. Restaurant on site quite enjoyable too.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel Right Across the Street from Farmer's Market”
Reviews.Author: KentWalker
Reviews.Content: If the idea of staying across the street from the Los Angeles Farmer's Market (an LA landmark that's a permanent farmer's market as well as a touristy shopping center of sorts) as well as the cool and much newer outdoor mall The Grove is something that sounds great, then Farmer's Daughter is the place to stay. Located directly across the street from the Farmer's Market, it's an old-school motel that's been remodeled in a kitschy, yet fun country style, with a touch of the newer, hip stainless steel touches of a more modern hotel. We stayed in one of their suites, which was a pretty large common room which had a futon of sorts in it that was comfortable for our four year-old to sleep on as well as a small kitchenette with refrigerator, sink, two burners and pots and pans to boot (strangely, though, no microwave). The bathroom was nice and clean with a cool rain shower head. The bedroom was pretty small with a very comfortable king bed (that I think had one of the memory foam mattress topper on it). We had a great night's sleep. Both rooms had large flat screen TVs and the one in the common room also had a DVD player that we used and looked great. Just outside of our room (#200) there was a cool open air patio area with some nice outdoor furniture and a coffee table. It's a nice place to relax at the end of the day. They have valet parking that they charge for (I think it was $11 a day) but it's very convenient. and it's easy getting in and out. Attached to the hotel is a restaurant called Tart. where we had a great breakfast (I have a separate review of that). The Farmer's Daughter hotel is a great place to stay in the Fairfax district by Farmer's Market with lots to do nearby. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: brittany_sorensen8
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to attend a taping of The Price is Right. The hotel is directly across from CBS Studios, which was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly, giving us some great recommendations for the area (we had never been to LA). We were walking distance from the Farmer's Market and several other attractions. Our lock broke and the staff worked really hard to fix it, but we had to exchange rooms in the end. We received a breakfast voucher for the restaurant there, Tart, which has DELICIOUS breakfast! Only complaint was the noise at night and that the beds are extremely hard, but other than that, very clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great staff, but a tad pricey and not conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in April along with some colleagues: we were there for a business meeting. The 'farming' theme is quirky and charming, the rooms are very comfortable, there is free wifi (that was reliable and reasonably fast) and the staff are all very, very friendly and helpful. When I stayed there for the same visit last year the lady at the front desk very kindly rang Delta to chase the suitcase that they'd lost on my trip in while I slept, and made sure that they'd got it to the hotel by the following morning. On this visit, the staff in the restaurant didn't hassle us while we chatted and finished up our drinks long past closing time, even though they must really have wanted to close the place up and go home. The organisation whose meeting we were attending booked and paid for the rooms for us, and so I can't comment on or give a rating for value. The location is great if you have a car with you (it was about 15 minutes' drive to our destination close to Ivar and Sunset) and the nightlife at the Farmers' Market complex opposite is definitely a plus. No need to drive home, and therefore worry about alcohol intake during your evening! But if you don't have a car and you're visiting for Hollywood tourism, you're looking at some long walks or hefty taxi fares for your daytime activity. My only two negative reactions were that the hotel's restaurant not opening until 8am rules out having breakfast before leaving for a meeting at the start of the working day, and is a bit of a downside for business travellers. There are plenty of places to eat at the Farmers' Market opposite the hotel that are open early, but this is less convenient than just being able to get a quick breakfast inside you in the hotel restaurant and head off. Secondly, the valet parking charge levied in addition to the room charge (which is not optional: if you want to park at the hotel, you have to pay it) was substantial ($38 for the three nights I was there), and with public transport not really being an option for guests at this hotel, should have been incorporated into the room charge in my opinion. But in the broad scheme of things, these are minor issues with what is a great place to stay. The helpful and welcoming staff are a huge asset, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place on that basis alone.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tcupit
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here on a trip to the Price is Right. The staff is just great. Everyone is so nice and friendly. The valet was super courteous and the front desk tried to accomodate our every need. They even have a little school in the lobby with tips on the Price is Right. Mr. Ted Ott(the teacher) is extremely nice and a pleasure to talk with. The restaurant is great and once again, the staff there is great. Overall, a very good experience! Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: empress_cherry
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for it's location, and it really was fabulous - just across the road from the brilliant Farmer's Market and a comfortable walk to Melrose Ave's great shops. The hotel itself was also nice - I loved the farm-kitch decor; my roon was clean, comfortable and large (even tho I booked a single!); I had no problems with noise (I was there mid-week in April tho - there might be more noise on warm weekend nights); there was free internet in the lobby, I was charged fairly for my phone calls (I think this is the only hotel I stayed at in the US which didn't charge me for making toll-free calls), and the staff were friendly and efficient (I didn't ask them for anything difficult or unsual tho). I paid 196AUD/night (including tax) thru Expedia, I think that is fair, but I haven't stayed at any other LA hotels so I can't say whether this hotel is good value for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel/motel right next to an amazing farmer's market”
Reviews.Author: CheapButSmart
Reviews.Content: I thought I would like this place and I was right. The only reason I didn't bother taking photos is that everyone else who has stayed here has beaten me to the punch. We loved the design and the feel of this place. Loved not having to worry about parking our rental car -- just valet it and forget about it. Super easy! Our room was simple but very comfortable and cute. We had a mini fridge that was blessedly empty (I hate pre-stocked hotel fridges) and very comfy beds. This is not a swanky hotel, just a superbly designed/remodeled motel. We never got a chance to eat at Tart but the outdoor dining area looked fantastic. Maybe we'll get to that on our next LA trip, because we would definitely stay here again. Also - do not miss the farmer's market across the street. Some of the best food you'll have anywhere. Overall a great experience. I can't think of any problems.

Reviews.Title: “zero star for hammering noise @ 1 am loud enough to wake everybody up”
Reviews.Author: imkea
Reviews.Content: complaints about that noise were heard in the lobby the following morning from multiple guests. the explanation by staff was :" oh , we had a lot of complaints about that. it is construction from the bank next door." yeah right, in the middle of the night. sounds like woody allen is breaking into that one... our guess was , it is the pipe system of the hotel: each time , s.b. uses water, you can hear that hammering noise through the whole south building. they cannot fix it, too expensive to get new pipes for an entire building. sorry, no sleep, no star :( . maybe the north building doesn't have that problem...

Reviews.Title: “Hipster vibe but not too cool to be nice to kids!”
Reviews.Author: LAnative1
Reviews.Content: This place is quirky and effortless. I am a LA native. This is a true LA experience. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: laanmt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing the location was just right you could easlily walk to the farmers market and have dinner there.If you arive at the hotel between 5 and 6 you get free glasses of wine cheese and crakers and an upgrade.And some of the best homemade lemonade. The rooms were very nice and diffrent than any place that i would have normaly stayed at but i loved it. The staff was helpful even thought they recomended a terrable thai resturant.the Quality of the sleep was ok because it LA its always loud. I fell asleep to the music of the resturant in the courtyard. And the pool was freezing.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, right accross form great food at the farmer's market”
Reviews.Author: docfamily164
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 4 nights whilst sightseeing in la. didn't want to rent a car . location was great, kids loved the grove and we ate daily at the farmer's market. Good public transport links for buses and taxis always about. walked to Tar Pits. Hotel very clean and staff friendly and helpful, booked sightseeing tours for us and gave good advice for travelling in LA. Beds comfy but was kept awake at night by the noise from the ice machine at end of corridor. Took me a while to figure out where it was coming from and finally on last night tracked it down. Restaurant pricey but good food. Pool very small but my youngest daughter liked it. Would definately stay here again for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: marktwb
Reviews.Content: This is a very affordable place to stay in LA. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Great location right across the street from CBS and the Farmers Market. If you are going to LA to see The Price Is Right, which is why we were there, this is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel ? Hardly, This is a bizarre place, find something else”
Reviews.Author: gotbagswilltravel
Reviews.Content: From the dreadful outside paint job to the linoleum, yup, linoleum floors and paper thin walls, this hotel is bizarre. Mona and Barney were staying next door, sowing their wild oats most of the night. It's amazing, the bedding and linens were top notch, but the farmer decor just doesn't work. Someone had the idea of doing a quick, cheap cosmetic job on an OLD building, and somehow they did a great marketing job, cause they have customers.

Reviews.Title: “It's the only place to stay if attending THE PRICE IS RIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: mlamames
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to attend The Price is Right this is the PERFECT location. I've stayed here before for this very reason. The atmosphere is a little hoe-dunk but the hotel is clean and safe and like I said PERFECT location and that is what really matters. The staff is very professional and friendly and willing to answer any questions you may have. The wake-up call is a bit comical too....Cock-a-Doodle Doo this is your wake up call!

Reviews.Title: “Always charming”
Reviews.Author: egerstan
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at the Farmer's Daughter and we really think it can't be beat for location, charm and comfort at a reasonable price (for a big city). The staff was especially helpful in adjusting our reservations (twice) due to weather issues; the room is comfortable and it is so convenient to the Farmer's Market/Grove for breakfast or other meals or quick errands.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: fourczyzs
Reviews.Content: Whenever my wife and I visit our daughter in LA, we always stay at the Farmer's Daughter Hotel. It's clean and reasonably priced, it's in a very convenient location in LA and it's right across the street from the famous Farmer's Market. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Over-Hyped”
Reviews.Author: zockso
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I stayed here for two nights. I chose the hotel based on a friend's recommendation of the attached restaurant (Tart) and the close location to the Farmer's Market and Grove shopping center. I left feeling stunned by all of the glowing reviews I read about this motel before our trip. The farm theme is a good one, and they could have done something much better with it - the rooms are basic motel rooms. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the parking lot. It had a couple quirky paintings of farm animals on the walls, but other than that there were no special touches to the decor. There is no room service, even though they have a nice restaurant right downstairs (if there is room service, they don't have any information on how to access it from the room). The staff was nothing special, and they didn't even bother to ask how our stay was when we checked out. They charge $4 per hour for WiFi, which is just ridiculous. We will not stay here again - though the location was great, it was way overpriced for such a basic motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and clean...close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mscaccia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 days to see LA. The hotel is right across the street from The Grove shopping area and the Farmers Market. It is very reasonably priced for a hotel in LA. It is stylish, very clean, and has a quaint feel to it, but with all the modern amenities...It has a great restaurant (Tart) attached where we had the best breakfast. They valet park your car and you can take it in and out all day and night which is very helpful!! I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Pups74
Reviews.Content: Love this place, have been staying there for years and its both comfortable (have had the best nights sleep there - as the beds are firm and very clean) un pretencious and relaxed but the service of a 5 star place. There is only one downside....if you have a room near the smoking area, you do get the smell a little bit (but not really an issue). The restaurant is great, wondeful breakfast and you have the benefit of a fridge in your room to by things locally to snack on. Staff really friendly, good location with loads of places to visit in the surrounding area and above all the only place I have found, that you can label 'value for money' - they do great deals including valet and breakky online and no hidden cost. A def 100% return for me. - oh and there is free wi-fi!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Confortable”
Reviews.Author: Travler98
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Clean room, funky and great location. Near a great Deli, great Sushi, and a shops and movie theater. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “What FUN!!! We loved the whole deal. Great location, great staff, way FUN!”
Reviews.Author: OregonFarmgirl
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful.... we'll spread the news wide and far. Tart was a fabulous Christmas breakfast. We had our family in a suite for Christmas Eve and Christmas. Dined and movied, shopped at the Grove. Hiked Runyon Canyon after fabulous breakfast on Christmas. Adam the front desk guy was such a delight. The valet, the waiters... perfect. We will definately be back. We too have a "farm stay " on our farm in Oregon. We have it decorated very "agri-chic", and fun. So much appreciated. all your details.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: seasidemicrotel
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The hotel is cute, chic, trendy, and boutique in every way. Don't get me wrong you have to appreciate older places brought back to life, and boy did they do a great job bringing this place back to life! The pool, restaurant, and decor are total fun. Also so close to everything... Hollywood, the Formosa Cafe, Shopping, CBS, and the Farmers Market. You have to experience the Farmers Daughter. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: cancankimber05
Reviews.Content: This was the place to stay. We could walk to the Grove and the Farmer's Market, were only minutes from the Beverly Center and Melrose, and the rooms were just fun!

Reviews.Title: “No sleep at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThatsJustMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: As observed by other reviewers, this facility appears to be a motel converted to a hotel by closing public access to what used to be a parking lot and is now used for valet parking. My friends and I occupied two rooms on the first floor, both of which face the parking lot. One of our party was flying in from another state, and I picked her up at LAX and returned to the hotel at approximately midnight. When we arrived there were a group of what I presume were hotel guests in the parking lot, apparently enjoying one another's company. Their enjoyment (along with yelling and loud laughter) escalated until I finally called the front desk at 1:15 AM to ask them to call a halt to the party. Though I believe their response was prompt since the noise stopped within a minute of my call, it frankly should not have been necessary for me to call in the first place. The desk clerk could undoubtedly hear the noise, both because of the volume and the proximity of the party to the registration desk. I can only conclude that no action was taken before because it never occurred to management that guests might want to sleep during pre-dawn hours. I chose this facility only because of the location. I expected little and was still disappointed. Almost any motel or hotel should be able to deliver a place to get a decent night's rest. That didn't occur the night I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kammil
Reviews.Content: This hotel (motel-like) is in pretty good location, next to Farmer's Market in West Hollywood. Rooms are of a decent size, clean and generally quite comfortable. Unfortunately, the reception staff was not very pleasant and they clearly find it difficult to smile. Once, cleaner left our room unlocked after cleaning and was left like that until I returned in the evening. After complaining and making my dissatisfaction very apparent, receptionist apologized and gave us some breakfast vouchers. I would hesitate returning to this hotel, but again, overall, it was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place and close to CBS Studios”
Reviews.Author: jbk51691
Reviews.Content: This place is literally across the street from CBS Studios, The Farmers Market, The Grove and Pan Pacific Park. If location is important to you this place is it! It is also a very quaint and cool place. No frills place but still very nice. The property includes a pool, restaurant, parking, snacks in the lobby, parakeets in the lobby, lounge areas, vending machines etc. I would definitely come back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: zelda_k
Reviews.Content: What a great find! The Farmers Daughter was recommended to us by a friend (an LA local), and being so close to the Farmers Market and The Grove and not far from W Hollywood we thought we'd stay the night there. We were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful service at the front desk and by the large size and funky decor of the rooms. Even though it has a slight 'motel' look to it, it is really more like a hotel. I can also recommend the Thai restaurant just a block down the road, if you don't feel like venturing too far away from the hotel - amazing food and well priced. All in all, love this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Farmer's Daughter”
Reviews.Author: YHSTeacher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekend get-a-way to Los Angeles. The Farmer's Daughter was a real treat. We arrived mid-morning, and although check-in was not officially until 4 p.m., the front-desk staff offered to have a room ready for us within the hour. They held our bags while we walked across the street to historic Farmer's Market for lunch and sightseeing. When we returned around 3 p.m. our room was ready. We loved the "cute and country" decorating, and we found the room clean and pleasant. We were concerned that since our room overlooked the Tart restaurant's courtyard seating below that we would be kept awake with noise, but it was simply not that type of crowd. We had a few minor issues: the filter for the in-room coffee maker had not been emptied, the room did not have a clock (no biggie since this was a pleasure trip), and the rocking chair looked like it needed a steam cleaning. Minor issues to be sure, and I have paid much more for far worse rooms. The Farmer's Daughter is literally right across the street from Farmer's Market and the Grove shopping center. Hollywood Blvd., Sunset, and Melrose were within a 10 minute drive. All in all, the room was great, the staff was very friendly, and the hotel in general was well worth the money. We're already looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if priority is location, not frills”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_ey
Reviews.Content: Pros: Loved being across the street from the Farmers Market, near museums and good restaurants, at a central starting point for anywhere else you need to go. Good to have car on site if you need to access it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Loved having breakfast at Tart in the morning--good food and a space you'd go out of your way to get to, but it's right downstairs. Cons: While we liked the funky decor, the rooms were a bit austere and somewhat dark. We didn't hear noise from other rooms, but we definitely heard noise from the hallway--the bare, open spaces really echo. These wouldn't prevent us from returning but it did prevent me giving it a 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great and super fun hotel...... the staff was a hoot!”
Reviews.Author: maineduane
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in downtown LA! could not have asked for a better experience to say the least. I stayed here with my brother who lives in LA and we had a grand time. If you are looking for a 5 star experience.... look elsewhere. This was a great hotel that was more than hokey. It made me feel like I was staying at my gradma's place in northern MN, or my mom's in rural Maine. A GREAT oasis in a sea of pompousness. The food at Tart was out of this world! I pre-purchased the dinner as part of the package... I highly recommend to say the least. The other great feature was the valet parking. When in LA one often has to contend with off site valet parking where they are not responsible for damage done to a car. The fact is that they spirit your car off to gosh knows were. At the Daughter, they have on site valet parking... unheard of in LA...... It was also right next to the Farmer's Market.... that in itself was a great deal of fun! Just a great stay with great people... very personable and kind. If you are looking for the Ritz Carlton experience this is not it, nor does it even attempt to be... If you are looking to really relax and find an oasis of hokey downtown cool.... this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Motel - not a hotel . . . and many other misleading features”
Reviews.Author: VideoMaker2112
Reviews.Content: When booking this boutique hotel, it seemed like a deal. Granted, the hotel was clean and the amenities satisfactory; however, the staff was incredibly rude and unaccommodating. This establishment seems to get off on nickel and diming people. For instance, the beds are very small (no way one double room can accommodate three people comfortably); moreover, the staff would not allow us to put a roll away bed in the room, so we had to rent a second room. This room was quite a bit more expensive than the first. When i inquired why, I was told that if I wanted a "deal" I would need to order the second room online (the staff refused to help me with this). I did order the second room online (as instructed); however, my reservation did not do through since I was already registered as a hotel guest - what a nightmare. So . . . instead of $140 per night, I ended up paying $200 per night. The last day of our stay, I needed a 2-hour late checkout (since we were doing business in the area), and I was charged an additional $79 for each room. (I was told that if I had gone an extra hour, I would have been charged the full rate.) When I needed to meet with some clients in the hotel, the hotel would not let us meet in their courtyard or lobby. Instead, I was forced to rent the worst conference room for $250 (Costco tables, folding chairs, and maybe the ugliest paint job I have ever seen). Do not stay here. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to American Girl Place”
Reviews.Author: charsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little pricey even for April but I loved the fact that we could walk to Farmers' Market and American Girl Place. I stayed here with my 4 yr. old daughter. We ate breakfast here instead of taking the bus to some famous pancake place. I was sure glad we did the chocolate chip pancakes, smoked applewood bacon, cheesy grits and fresh squeezed orange juice were delectable! The staff let me keep my car on their lot for the day eve though we had to check out by 11 am. I will say that their website makes their hotel look much nicer than it really is. I can't really complain though. We had a clean room. a pool to swim in, great food and it was walking distance to our destination.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and depressing”
Reviews.Author: meitaki
Reviews.Content: Funky denin bed covers and cushions and good quality toiletries doesn't make up for this so called hotel being a depressing place to stay. Firstly, it is not a hotel but a motel and while the rooms were clean, there were no frills. The "wardrobe" had a cheap looking curtain across it and the room was quite frankly stark. It was also dark and depressing with (again funky) but inadequate lighting. The air conditioning unit was powerful but noisy and traffic on the man road is invasive. I was in a second floor unit away from the road but I could still hear it all night. There was only a coffee making machine (not kettle for Brits who prefer tea, and small plastic straws to stir with). The accommodation is also grossly overpriced for a basic motel. It's one big advantage is its proximity to the Farmers Market shopping centre. Definitely NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Farmer's Daughter before going to the Price is Right the next day. We booked last minute and were stuck with rack rates. A little high but well worth the convenience. The hotel is located on Fairfax, across the street from the Farmer's Market. Check in was very easy and quick. Our room was on the second floor of the building across the parking lot. The room was well appointed with 2 queen beds, large flatscreen tv, DVD player, iPod clock radio. The convenience of peeking out our room to see if others were lining up yet for TPIR was, well, priceless. This allowed us to throw our clothes on at 5am, run across the street to get our passes, then return to the hotel to shower and change. We checked out at 8:30am, but left our car with valet parking for the day. We didn't eat at Tart, but opted for breakfast at the Farmer's Market. The only criticism or suggestions I could give to the hotel would be to offer free Wi-Fi rather than ethernet Internet for $9.95/day and the plumbing was a bit loud in our building (could hear when any one flushed). Yes, I would stay at again, or recommend Farmer's Daughter to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cool”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: For a while this was my defacto hotel in Los Angeles. It was kitchy and clean and neer where I wanted to be. As one could guess the place has a farm theme which could be tired but to me it's a winner. My favorite room was the "Don't tell" suite which comes with a wet bar and mirrored ceilings! The televisions in the hotel are small, the bathrooms are small and the pool is small. I guess it's all about the decor and the location right across from the farmers market and the Grovve that make this place worth it. On the F & B side I can say that the restaurant, "Tart" was nice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super location”
Reviews.Author: ded2525
Reviews.Content: The location is great, as you are within walking distance to the Grove and Farmer's Market. The staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudiaspiandorim
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel last January , and we were very pleased with it. It is not a luxury hotel, but it is very clean, modern and cute. The room was a nice size, and well-maintained. We had breakfast at their restaurant once, and it was very good. There is even a small pool for the warm days! But the best thing about this hotel is its location: it is right in front of the Farmers Market/The Grove shopping complex. You can find a wide variety of food, for every pocket and taste, and The Grove shopping area is very pleasant and upscale. For our family, it was perfect. Our 8-year-old daughter loved it! The only downside is that they charge you US$ 17.00 for valet service (daily), but this is LA...If you are looking for charm and location, you won't regret it - this a sure bet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little surprise”
Reviews.Author: mythrenegade
Reviews.Content: What has been done here is amazing. I have no idea what this place used to look like, but I imagine it was like every other run down motel that most people wouldn't be caught dead in. They took it and made it something truly special. The rooms are charming farmer kitch, but clean and modern. I do not typically use the tv in a room, and true to form I never turned this one on. But it's a very nice flat panel with a DVD player, meaning that if I had time I could watch a movie on it rather than on my laptop. The staff was wonderful to me, although my interaction was limited. The location across the street from the farmer's market & the grove is awesome. For breakfast I walked across the street and purchased some amazing fresh fruit and a fresh pastry. Great way to start the day. It's not perfect though. I am sensitive to noise, and the air conditioner is loud, even when on fan only. The fridge bothered me for a while but I got used to it. These are common problems to most motel type properties so this wouldn't scare me away at all, you just need to be aware of it. This is not the ritz carlton, but it's a delightful little hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: LibbySydney
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Farmer's Daughter at the end of our 2.5 week holiday. It was a very pleasant way to end the trip. The hotel rooms are not flash but they are clean, large and comfortable (great bed). Really enjoyed the hotel as it was like a home away from home as it was very relaxed with lots of places to sit and do nothing. Also loved the hot apple cider and cookies at reception. The staff were great, helped us with all our queries and requests and we had lots. Had dinner one night at Tart and the food was very good and service while relaxed was very friendly. Location was fabulous, so good we didn't need to rent a car but walked and used the buses. Would definitely recommend this as a reasonably priced well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pompous owner great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tintree
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in January 2008. I was scheduled to be on the price is right. The hotel is located right across the street from CBS studios which made it convenient. This hotel has been here for years and has been popular spot for secret rendeveous. I think the new owners have done a wonderful job. I hear the brains behind this new face lift is the wife. Every thing you have been reading in these reviews are right on the money. The whole modern farm theme works well and no one else is doing it in LA. The staff is great and helpful. Unfortunately I did hear the male owner being imeprialistic and talking down to them. As I was walking to my room I happen to walk by the owner near the pool and asked where I could get argetine barbeque. He was very arrogant with a cunning smile. He just pointed and said "over there" which made no sense. The next morning I saw him again at the front desk and asked for extra towels and he said what happen to the ones in the room? told him I used it to wipe up the wet floor and he just shook his head and walked away. This guy just doesn't seem happy. I would try to avoid him and speak to other staff members. Overall the value is great and the location is ideal. Close to hollywood and beverly hills. I would stay there again.!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I would recommend the Farmers Daughter”
Reviews.Author: jonnytraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife had our honeymoon in the US and stayed in Las Vegas (Venetian and Bellagio), Hawaii (Outrigger on the Beach) and LA where we stayed at the Farmers Daughter. It may sound a little strange, but this was our favorite hotel. It was friendly, comfortable and in a great location. Of course the hotel didnt have the luxuries the other hotels we stayed in had, however we picked this hotel as it was recommended by a friend. what made the hotel good for us were little things such as: - we didnt have to take an elevator to our room - it took only one minute to get from the room to the street - the free internet (after paying $15/30mins in vegas) - the personal service that only comes wth a smaller hotel - the choice of restaurants within 500m of the hotel, not sure how many there are but there would be 10+ - great locaton The hotel wasnt overly romantic for our honeymoon, but if you are after a comfortable place to stay I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fun LA hotel”
Reviews.Author: hwtraveller
Reviews.Content: I liked the Farmers Daughter... Nicely designed reception with young, helpful staff and lots of quirky, colourful touches. Tart restaurant is very nice (although service could be a bit erratic) - great place to start the day with breakfast. Pool is small but big enough for a quick dip and really nicely presented. Our room was pretty spacious (deluxe king) with nice touches like cool magazines and restaurant guides, and great toiletries. Not luxurious, but nicely decorated and again slightly quirky and fun. Bathroom is a pretty unreconstructed motel bathroom but it's clean and functional. Location was good - opposite the Grove mall and Farmers Market food mall, and only c.15 mins drive to Hollywood and c.30mins drive to Santa Monica. I thought price was pretty reasonable (best if you can get a deal with parking and breakfast included). You might be disappointed if you're looking for somewhere uber swanky and bling, but if you want somewhere friendly and stylish, I'd give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 123Avila
Reviews.Content: I was curious about Farmer's Daughter, so I went there in August, and I was disappointed. The location is great, across Farmer's Market, rooms are clean and pleasant, but nothing special. The hotel tries to look rustic, but needs more imagination and talent in this area. The room came to $218 with parking, which was really too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Again”
Reviews.Author: mari777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farmer's Daughter for the second time around this year and again had a great experience! We booked the "lovers and players room" it featured a king sized bed (very comfortable) with a down blanket. It also had some cool blue lighting around the ceiling area, a mirror on the ceiling and headboard and a nice little wet bar and fridge. The room was very clean and the location couldnt be better for us with east access to the Farmer's Market, West Hollywood and many other LA attractions. There is no doubt we will return again and again. Staff nice and friendly, Tart restaraunt very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: gringa-1
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Los Angeles if you want to walk places. Hotel is very casual, rooms are good - bedroom in suite is a little tight, and the sofa bed in the living room would not be comfortable for an adult, perfect for a family with kids though. Breakfast not included Small kitchenette is practical,though no toaster or microwave provided ??? Best part: Right across the street from the Farmer's Market and the Grove. Lots to do day and night. Also very close to the La Brea Tar Pits and LACMA. Staff is very pleasant. There is a daily charge for internet in rooms and for parking.. Computer in lobby for guest use. Lighting in rooms could be better, but the location makes it all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Farmers Daughter - Third Visit Better than Before”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Farmers Daughter. The last review I gave wasn't very good, but it was an honest review based on experience. We were going to the taping of The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson across the street at CBS, so if nothing else, this hotel is convenient for that. It was just the one night stay and we had been at the Disneyland Hotel for the 3 nights prior, so I knew we would be arriving there early and requested that since I needed to be at CBS before 3:30 pm, would they please block a room for me if one becomes available by noon and the front desk graciously gave me a room ready to check into at 1:30 pm. I did purchase the package of room, breakfast for two at TART (the on site restaurant) and valet parking, which cost less than the price of the room, so if you decide to book this hotel, explore that option. The parking valet was very helpful when we arrived, even helped us with luggage and the front desk clerk was smiling and welcoming and of course, accommodating with that early check in. (Don't be afraid to ask for an earlier check in, they are happy to oblige IF the rooms are available) This time our room was nicer than the prior visit, both bedroom and bathroom. My only complaint is the internet, for whatever reason, my Windows Vista has problems accessing their internet. Last time I was there, I was on the phone with tech help for 1/2 hour before I was finally connected, but when I got home, from all their reconfigurations, I couldn't connect to my home network. So this time, I just avoided using internet for one night. Our free breakfast at TART was better than I expected, my husband had strawberry pancakes that looked fantastic and I had French Toast, which was delicious. Service was great. Check out was smooth and since the hotel is small, valet was quick. Being a big fan of Craig Ferguson, we go to tapings of The Late Late Show as often as we're able to get to LA, and I would definitely stay at the Farmers Daughter again next time. Just a note: This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel, it's not the Ritz, but adequate, convenient and comparable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “stylishly renovated motel”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Cobbley
Reviews.Content: Great location on Fairfax, good size room, well appointed, and loved the wooden floors. Valet parking at standard LA rates, but little or no waiting time, and TART restaurant next door, all contribute to Farmer's Daughter being just about the best value in LA right now. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but charming oasis in LA”
Reviews.Author: joemess
Reviews.Content: We just finished on our 4 night stay on June 25, 2008 and I must say that we're glad we chose the Farmer's Daughter. As soon as we walked in we were greeted warmly, and in fact this is true every time you walk through the lobby. The staff make you feel as if you were part of the family. We were even referred to as friends! Now I know this is part of their job, but isn't it nice to have such treatment? The rooms were cute - no luxury, but very clean and well kept. Decorations are cute and the space is comfortable. Bed was surprisingly comfortable and we were able to have a good night's sleep. Bathroom is clean and up-to-date. Only drawback is limited storage space. There is a closet and two drawers, but that's pretty much it. Since we're used to living out of our bags, it was OK, but if you're a clothes horse and need lot's of drawers and cabinets, this might not be the place for you. We opted for the included breakfast at a small charge (Note that they might have since changed their policy and you might be able to get it included as a package). The breakfast was absolutely wonderful and very filling. The price we paid upfront would've only been for one breakfast and we got two. They were so filling, we hardly had lunches. The location is very nice, especially if you don't like to be around the congested tourist areas, like Hollywood Blvd. It was peaceful and nice, and the close proximity to the Farmers Market was a plus. It is in walking distance of some nice museums, and if you don't want to take the car, there is a bus stop right in front (must say that buses were surprisingly easy to get around with and a very good value with a day pass) Overall, stay was great and we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Price and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: nashvegas1
Reviews.Content: We had a conference downtown -- the Farmer's Daughter was so well priced and a great location. Just 20 mins from the convention center. and you're right across the street from The Grove and Farmer's Market. It's unbelievable to find a great hotel that's in walking distance to anything in LA. The rooms are comfy, with great beds and towels. The front desk folks are VERY helpful and nice. All in all, a wonderful stay. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: allen_rick_pat
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter is a cute, kitschy place to stay. The staff is very helpful and sweet. Not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination, but if you want that, stay at the Hotel Bel-Air. Within easy walking distance of the Farmer's Market, of course, but so much more: Regency Cinema ("art house") is two blocks up Fairfax, Canter's Delicatessen is maybe three blocks up Fairfax. There's a flea market , the Melrose Trading Post, in the parking lot of Fairfax High, every Sunday from 9AM-5PM, maybe four blocks. It's a 20-minute walk to Museum Mile: the Los Angeles County Museum/Broad Gallery, the Folk Art Museum, and the Petersen Automotive Museum. I believe that the Hammer Museum is not much further away. Another 20-minute walk in the opposite direction puts you on Melrose Ave., home to the Groundlings Theater (improv home of Phil Hartman) and the Silent Movie Theater (the name says it all), and trendy--UGH--shopping. You can even get to the Beverly Center in about 20 minutes. In other words, fun hotel, absolutely unbeatable location. You CAN visit LA and not be sucked into car culture!

Reviews.Title: “fab experience”
Reviews.Author: dudette08
Reviews.Content: it was a great place to stay would deffinately recommend to anyone. in a great location with short cab ride or bus ride away from most things. the farmers market opposite is really nice with places to eat and shops etc. very friendly staff and clean rooms. everything you would want and need in a hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pudgie
Reviews.Content: Went through a lot of web sites and decided that Farmer's Daughter was a place to try. We had tickets for the 100th taping of Dancing with the Stars. There were lower priced hotels such as the Rodeway Inn but decided to try this one. It was a nice place with nothing exceptional. The room was nice and a little rustic. Size of the room was reasonable and the bath/shower was fine along with television. Internet access was around $10 and they had the normal make your own coffee pot. We ate two meals at the restaurant (Tart) and they were a little expensive but very good and probably for the area, the price was reasonable. Of course the main reason to stay here is location, location, location. It is very convenient for attending the Price is Right show as you just go across the street at 6 a.m. to get your order of arrival tag, then at 8 get your ticket changed and 9 get in line for the 1 p.m. show. Since you'll be there all day, it's nice to have the hotel just across the street. For the Dancing with the Stars show, you have to walk to the other side of the CBS Studios but it would be the same as if you parked either at the Farmer's market or Grove since CBS has no public parking. The Farmer's Market has changed to basically a cacophony of fast food restaurants so you can virtually find anything you want to eat there. We ate twice at McGee's deli where the corn beef is just exceptional. In addition, the new Grove shopping center is a real upscale mall along the line of Disney's "Downtown" with a free tram which runs back and forth through the shopping area. I would go back to Farmer's Daughter hotel because of the convenience and would recommend that others wanting to attend shows at the CBS studios consider this place. If you've seen enough of LA and are there just for the shows, it's a great place as you can find everything you need by just walking. Note that CBS has two television studios so be sure you know which one you want.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: Lukehead
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wedding weekend at The Farmer's Daughter. Arrangements made by bridal couple to use Farmer's Daughter as wedding party central Great choice. Delightful and most accommodating staff. Very relaxed atmosphere, certainly not chi chi but not trying to be either. Witty decor that was clever but not too cutesy. Very comfortable beds. Lighting could be a bit better but you don't go to Los Angeles to sit in your room and read. Super comp toiletries of "lather" brand. Great location. Across the street from CBS Studios, LA Farmer's Market and The Grove shopping area. An easy walk to LACMA, Page Museum and LaBrea Tar Pits, Craft and Folk Art Museum. Many restaurants of various cuisines within walking distance. Only valet parking available at hotel. I think it is probably reasonably priced for the area and does allow for in and out privileges. There are street parking spaces in the area but not sure of the time restrictions. All the staff we encountered, from the front desk to housekeeping, were very friendly, polite, helpful. We were greeted by all employees we encountered with a smile. Quick to respond to special requests. So many of the reviews have been less than kind re treatment by the employees and noise - we experienced nothing like those reports. Maybe because we were there on the weekend, the guests had a different focus. No excitement from the Price is Right hopefuls but there were wedding celebrants. Noise level was not disruptive. Also no noise from the open sided restaurant on the first level. All rooms are non-smoking. There is a well maintained open-air lounge area outside the 2nd floor rooms where smoking is allowed. Never "smoky" and always cleaned of smokers' debris. partly by staff, partly by respectful guests. Pool was well maintained but not used so no noise there either. Kitschy, quirky, overall a fun place. I would recommend to people wanting to have a relaxing, fun time.

Reviews.Title: “charming, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler91
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because we were attending a New Year's Eve function less than a mile away. I realize that our stay was on a "holiday" night, but I still feel it was way overpriced for the accomodations. Great location to Farmer's Market and The Grove; Tart, the restaurant, was very good, but also overpriced for breakfast. Rooms have hardwood floors, which are very charming, but NOISY! You can hear everyone in the surrounding rooms walking around. AND, when your neighbor is taking a shower - you can hear the water running like it's in your own room and when you turn it off, it makes this loud noise. Needless to say, woke up several times during the night from noises other than people in the halls or outside noise, both of which were not an issue at all. Staff was pleasant, valets were great. Room was clean, GREAT bed/ mattress. If it weren't for the location to our NYE event, would have rather spent this much money elsewhere. I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern spin on traditional charm”
Reviews.Author: Gammydodger
Reviews.Content: Was staying in LA for 2 nights with my girlfriend, her sister and nephew. Location was great, right opposite the farmer's market where there were plenty of restuarants and cafes and bars. An old motel updated with a great theme. Rooms were clean and modern, the hotel service was friendly, borrow DVDs for free, small pool, gated parking and the restaurant Tart was worth a visit in itself. Good venue all round and very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: hfed
Reviews.Content: I won a trip to LA and this is where the hotel was booked. I was concerned at first because I never heard of it but it was great! It was right accross from CBS studios and the Farmers Market and the Grove shopping areas. The shopping was fabulous. Every designer imaginable! The staff at the hotel were friendly and knew the area quite well. They recommended a Limo tour of LA and it was perfect. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Flat screens in each room. Easy access to the airport - no need to get on the Freeway. Close to Rodeo Drive and the Walk of Fame. Priced right. Yes, the name might throw you but give it a try - it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chigal82
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the farmer's daughter and was quite pleased. The location was perfect and central for all my needs. It was a quick walk across the street to the farmer's market and a comfortable walk to take in all the shops and restaurants on 3rd. We had breakfast in the adjoining restaurant (tart) and the hash browns were fantastic. We had had cocktails there the night prior and both times commented on how friendly the staff was. The room was very clean and cute (in a kitschy way). While the bed was large, it was very uncomfortable. Also, the walls are very thin, so you can hear everything that is happening in the next room. The bathroom was modern and clean. I would stay here again if the price was reasonable (less than $200) because of the great location. Any more than that and my expectations would be higher. I was also pleased with all of the employees I encountered. I had needed to change my reservation and they were very helpful. In particular, the valets were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, too pricey for the value”
Reviews.Author: neilnfw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Farmers' Suite this past weekend. This is a nice boutique-y hotel with a great location, close to the Grove and Beverly Center and an easy drive to anywhere on the West Side of LA. The room cost $250/night, and for that I might have expected a little more. Firstly, the Farmer's Suite is located right next to the elevator, so that people waiting to go up or down are waiting/talking/laughing/shouting right outside the front door of your room. Second, I echo the concern about no hand soap. Yes, there is a shower bar of soap, but nothing for the hands. The sink area was a little small. Third, there are no blackout shades in the room. I am not a heavy sleeper, and so I was awakened at 7:00 each morning by the sunshine. A nice touch if you want it, but I had fully intended to get some serious rest on this trip and the brightness of the room made that impossible. Fourth, the comfy couch that is advertised is anything but. It is small, with one large pillow, not at head level, and no armrests or throw pillows. It was very uncomfortable to watch TV on (at 7 AM after being awakened). Fifth, the TV and movie selection was quite subpar, and with great plasma TV's, one might expect a little better programming. Finally the architecture of the room itself--I stubbed my foot three times on a little jutting piece of wall right at bedside. I might stay there again, but certainly not in this overpriced suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but sub-par”
Reviews.Author: NevadaSteven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is heavy on kitsch but light on clean. There was no soap in the room (which still had leftover open toiletries from the last guest), and when we asked for some, housekeeping told me they didn't have any. The soap finally appeared about three hours later. But housekeeping didn't appear at all the next day, so the towels, bed, and trash were never removed or replaced. A call to the front desk got us an apology, but no clean towels. There were other annoyances to the room as well: no drawers to put your clothes, so we were forced to live out of our suitcase (ok for me, but not my wife), and the only way to turn on the bedside lights was to go to a switch at the front door. The hotel's location is great for anyone not wanting to drive all the time. It's across from the Farmer's Market and the Grove shopping district, so you can easily eat and see a movie without getting into your car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stylish hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: Hotel Very Nice Bed was Nice and comfy, which is very important to me, room was decorated in a farmyard style which I liked. It took a while to check us in even though there was no other guests in the reception, the member of staff seemed a bit moody but otherwise our stay was very nice. Very handy for CBS and the Grove/farmers market. Would I stay again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: hlpepper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. It is in an older part of LA and the surroundings are not much to look at. The hotel itself though has a very bouquet feel and was very nice inside. The valet was very nice and quick and the front desk staff was very helpful. The first thing you will notice when you enter is that the room has hardwood floors. Since I am not really a fan of carpet I thought this was really cool and nice. It also had a really cute water faucet. Pros - Cute, quiet, large. Has a DVD player, Frig and Coffeemaker. Also has a pool and restaurant and valet parking. Cons - I really only have one con I think I should warn someone about. I got in late in the evening and after I checked in I put my pj's on and put a DVD in the machine. I got the hotels information book so that I could look up the room service menu to order some diner. There was no room service! I was very tired from my long drive so instead of getting dressed again and going to the restaurant downstairs I just went to bed.

Reviews.Title: “staying in LA/Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: KyBoop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to LA for a wedding, and the bride reserved rooms at The Farmer's Daughter hotel. The staff were cordial, rooms clean and roomy, and a restaurant and bar are attached. The rooms have bare floors which is a nice change, and are not like the ordinary hotel room, but a refreshing difference. The hotel is located directly across from CBS studios, and just down the street is Farmer's Market. If you can't find what you're looking for here, it doesn't exist! Lots of name brand shops, big name stores, and all kinds of restaurants. At night, a band plays while people mill around eating ice cream - great place for kids and adults!

Reviews.Title: “Lost a loyal customer”
Reviews.Author: jdwrmr
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here numerous times.Our most recent stay will likely be our last.I made a 2 night reservation for a room with 2 beds.I called the day we were to check in to confirm reservation and room and was told everything was a requested. When we arrived, we were told they did not have a room with 2 beds and could only offer us a king and a roll away. The gentleman at the desk was friendly and felt bad, but didn't have any other option for us. He said they would have the proper room the next day. There are 4 people in my family and 3 of us had to share the king bed. The next day when we inquired about the room change, we were told that we would have to check out of the room we were in at 11am, bring our luggage downstairs and wait until another room was available between 11:30 and 1. There was no offer by the staff to move our luggage for us and the fact that we would actually be without access to a room or our luggage for hours was not acceptable. I left 2 messages with the GM for a call. Though our folio indicated that he left a msg on my cell phone he did not. They offered us a $25 discount for our troubles, but it has yet to appear on our credit card.I received a request from the hotel for feedback and shared all this in an email, which I also copied the GM on. It has been over a week since we were there and I have still not received a response. We really enjoyed our other stays, but it seems clear to me that they are not committed to customer retention.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: yougorgeousthing
Reviews.Content: This is a little treasure. I loved my stay at The Farmers Daughter a country feel with a twist of boutique kitch. It was like a home away from home. Rooms were clean and a very comfortable bed! Bathroom a little small, but the shower made up for it. It was brilliant - bring on the pressure!! The only thing was the toilet, it just was quite noisy when flushing. Staff were very friendly and down to earth. Would stop and have a chat whenever you walk by. Do go over to the Farmers Market. I loved it! I could spend hours walking around in there. Good for celebrity spotting too! It gets booked out quickly as the CBS Studios is next door and everyone that goes on the 'Price is Right' all stay here. Can't wait to come back here again. I really miss it!!

Reviews.Title: “Country Mouse meets Bright Lights of LA”
Reviews.Author: anniepetra
Reviews.Content: I was staying there on business for just one night so I didn't spend much time in my room or at the property. People at check in were very friendly and accommodating. The beds were super comfy and brand new pillows. The room was clean The bedspread - not as clean as I would have liked. The soap was great. The AC was noisy and I could barely sleep so you are better off staying there when it's not too hot. I asked about a nearby restaurant and they had no idea what I was talking about. The pool looked very clean and seemed like a nice place to hang out. Overall - they've done a nice job in converting a motel into a place that doesn't feel like a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very motel like but fun extras !”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel27
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading about it on a website made by the city of Los Angeles and before reading these reviews or else I'd definitely have considered other places for me (a 27 year old woman) and my 16 year old sister to stay at. I just wasn't worth the price ( $203 plus $14 and tip for the mandatory but definitely not necessary valet ). The place looks like an apartment complex from the 70's and I'm pretty sure the building is that old. The pool is tiny and only open till 7pm ! Smoking is allowed on the balconies and right in front of guest windows in the "barn" building which could be annoying. The grounds and room were clean and the service good (especially by Jean) but the lightbulb was out on the desk ( although replaced promply !) and we had to hold the i-pod at a certain angle for it to work in the dock on the alarm/radio ( that's cool that it was there though !). Other cool features were the shower head ( although there's no fan in the small bathroom) and faucet and a fold out map of L.A. attached to the keycard. The bed, sheets and towels were suprisingly of very good quality ! There are a few outdated dvds to rent at the front desk (for free !) and a lot to do around the hotel so the location is pretty convienient . We also took bus 14 from beverly and fairfax to downtown and back. If you like Thai food, Chao Krung is an amazing restaurant to try (111 n. Fairfax). So over all I was satisfied with my stay , it's just the price should be lower for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: winechick1
Reviews.Content: I was in LA with my sister for an event at the Kodak Theatre, and the farmers daughter is fairly close, plus its located directly across from the Grove which is one of our favorite Malls. With that said, location is great, but that's the only thing that it has going for it. First, we arrive a half an hour before check in, and were told there werent any rooms available until later that day. The person at the front desk was COMPLETELY rude. We had to change our clothes in a bathroom next to the pool, which was awful, and leave our bags with the front desk. We arrived back to the hotel at 10pm only to have to wait for the guy at the front to figure out how to work the system. We were given our key, and it didnt work, I went back down and had to wait even longer for him to get it right. There was no apology(by now it was almost 11pm). There was some sort of construction going on, and it was VERY loud until midnight. In the morning when I checked out, I asked the front desk(after waiting in line for a very long time, if there was a comment card I could fill out. He said "no,those are in the guest rooms". Seriously? Do not stay here, its very overpriced and service is abolutely awful.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stewmorr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Farmer's Daughter three times now, and the experience just gets better and better. Let me start at the beginning - check in. The reception staff found the booking immediately and right away I was treated like a family friend. It took no longer than a minute to be handed my key card and was told that they would phone me in a few minutes to see if I was happy with the room. Sure enough, they did and it was perfect! The rooms at the Farmer's Daughter are not luxurious. But they are clean, comfortable and, as far as I am concerned, nothing else matters. I know there have been complaints about the noise from guests getting up early to attend recordings at the studios across the road - I never heard them but maybe I was lucky. The rooms have TV, GREAT air con, wireless internet access (but, boooo, you have to pay for it which is the ONLY negative thing about the hotel!!) fantastic showers and very comfortable beds.
