Throughout my five day stay, the service was fantastic, from the lovely people on reception to the staff in the bar/restaurant - TART. (Boy, do they mix some mean cocktails!!) The swimming pool is small but very clean, and there are ample chairs etc around it,. The location is superb too - you can actually WALK to places which must be a first in LA! This is my favourite place to stay in LA and I have done them all from the Mondrian and the Standard to the Chateau and the Bel Age. If it is LA cool and hip you are after, then this isn't for you. Or is it?

Reviews.Title: “Motel Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MSPXelaforNow
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter is a motel without the usual horrible flowered bedspreads. The location is great. You can walk to the farmer's market for breakfast or down the street to a bunch of different cafes. The service was pretty good, but the bed was uncomfortable. Still, it is a reasonably priced option in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanAdwoman
Reviews.Content: After four visits to this well-located motel, I will have to look elsewhere due to the extraordinary pre-dawn noise when The Price is Right is taping (Monday through Friday mornings). People yell to each other outside their rooms and bang on doors to collect their crew as early as 3AM. The rowdy contestants line up across across the street from the motel, hoping to get into the studio audience. They evidently do not care if anyone in the hotel might want peace or quiet. The management of the hotel provides lots of advice to would-be contestants. Why don't they remind them to be considerate of guests who might be asleep at 3AM?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but.......”
Reviews.Author: canamgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the sole reason that it is located across the street from the Grove and our main purpose for being in LA (other than going on a cruise) was to take my daughter to American Girl which is located at The Grove. We only stayed 1 night, but it was long enough. The place looks like a dump from the outside, but inside it is neat and tidy. We booked the Farmers Suite and it was spacious for us and our 3 kids. The bathroom is the best feature with the nice shower and Lather bath products. I would not recommend this hotel for longer than 1-2 night stays. It is extremely noisy due to the fact that it fronts Fairfax Street. If you want a central location, this hotel is it. If you want peace and quiet (and romance), look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Farmers Daughter is a Treasure.”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelLover
Reviews.Content: Great place!!!!! We had an excellent stay at Farmers Daughter Hotel. The staff is wonderful and the service is unbeatable. You've got to try their quaint little restaurant called Tart, not only were there local people eating there but we were able to do some star gazing at the same time, it was great!! The rooms are like none other we've experienced in our travels. They have that awesome country theme that made us feel at home, from the comfortable beds to the flat screen tv's to the down home hospitality you definately get your money's worth. Don't miss this one when travelling to Los angeles!

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem.”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn_wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in early May and had a great time. The rooms are really cute, with fun details, and a great high pressure shower. Great location, across the street from the Grove, and easy access to West Hollywood and other spots. All in all would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the website fool you!”
Reviews.Author: schen75205
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something different to stay at in Los Angeles. Something fun and not too Hilton-ish. We came across the Farmer's Daughter Hotel on [--]. Did a web search and found their web site. We were very impressed by the web site and thought the hotel would be a great change from the chain hotels and the ultra expensive trendy hotels. The location of the the Farmer's Daughter is great...right across the street from the Farmer's Market and the Grove, and centrally located to most everything. However, don't let the chic facade of the outer walls fool you. Once you pass the lobby and head up to your room that's when the fun begins. You open the door and you are met with laminate wood-style floors and cheap quality furniture. The bedding and draps look like something you find at a second hand store. The cable television did not work for the two nights we were there. We felt like we were staying at a cheap motel...although the room was nearly $200 a night! I guess the best way to describe our experience was "oh...huh! Won't be staying there again!" The funny thing about the hotel is, it really epitomizes Hollywood...all glamorous and cool on the outside but inside it's just plan and ordinary trying to look impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Farmer's Daughter is Infested!”
Reviews.Author: Consequences
Reviews.Content: I was in L.A on a business trip and had no choice but to stay at this motel because of my jobs financial reasons. Well turns out room 202 were I stayed comes with infestation! I had to run to the emergency room the next day after my arrival because my entire body had developed red, itchy contagious bumps...I was diagnosed with SCABIES! Yes, that's right you heard correctly...Scabies. The hotel does not know this yet but believe me they have a bad thing coming. So if I were you, I would not even think of staying at this Farmer's Daughter home.

Reviews.Title: “clean, clean, clean”
Reviews.Author: dublinlassie
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We liked how clean it was. It did not have that awful smell like carpeted hotel rooms. We were a little leary about staying here, as we heard the area was not the best. We found it to be great, we loved being right across the street from CBS (as we went to TPIR) we also loved the farmers market we had breakfast there two mornings it was fine, and i loved The Grove it was so pretty and decorated nice for Easter. The staff were fine, not the friendliest i've ever encountered but we didn't have any problems so there really was no need for us to have any contact with them. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller007
Reviews.Content: Hotel was expensive (US$250 including tax) for what you got. There are no black out blinds and the gingham curtains, whilst cute, let all the light into the room. My room was really noisy, we could hear flushing water all night from other rooms and lots of traffic. The hotel is situated near a fire station so be prepared for sirens going through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for The Price is Right!!!”
Reviews.Author: reed13ja
Reviews.Content: If the purpose of your trip is to visit the Price is Right - this is the hotel you need to stay at hands down, no questions asked. It is the only hotel that this directly across from where the line forms. In addition, the hotel itself is very clean, comfortable, and well worth the price. I was worried b/c it is a renovated motel style place, but it was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in at that price range ever! Anyway, back to TPIR. Ted, who works at the hotel, gives a seminar on TPIR every night the night before there is a taping. The hotel is so convienient to the line for the multiple trips to and from the bathroom/taking shifts in line. Just know that the hotel does not allow you to take pillows/blankets from the room out to the line (so bring a sleeping bag). We were just there and filmed the Million Dollar Primetime Spectacular on Mon Apr 16th at 2:30PM. We got in line at 10AM on Sun Apr 15th. We were numbers 48 and 49 in line (you have to be in the first 300 to get in the show). Everyone who made it in to the audience spent the night on the street, so do yourself a favor and book this hotel. Ted has a picture of every winner who has stayed at the Farmer's Daughter - and trust me it is a large collection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: henulj-lse
Reviews.Content: The location is great! Right across the street from the Farmers Market and CBS Studios. Lots of things to do at Farmers Market Square. The rooms are clean and roomy. Bed was comfortable. They could use a more comfortable chair and dresser space for clothing. Had some police issues going on in the area, but we were there over St Pat's day AND you are in a metropolitan city. Even that did not make you feel unsafe. Close to Hollywood Blvd. Took the city bus there which was very easy. Otherwise, the all day tour we took, picked us up at the hotel. Did not need a car. Ted is also there to give advice on TPIR. I would definitely recommend staying at this property. If you prefer a five star hotel, do not stay here as it is a 2-3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: Diablocanyon1
Reviews.Content: I stayed February 25-27, 2007 and paid $136. This hotel has a great theme: gigham, denim, the country life. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I was amazed at the space in the room, very generous and the beds were reasonably comfortable. The four cup coffee maker helped during our TPIR sleep over. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Ted, because he gave us some pointers in an entertaining way. They only offer valet, but it's L.A. and you have to pay to park anywhere. The location can't be beat next to TPIR and the Farmer's Market and a short drive to Hollywood. Tart served a well portioned and reasonably priced breakfast. On TPIR taping days, they offer a breakfast sandwich and beverage for $6. They are designed to go with you while you wait in line. If I'm ever in that part of L.A. again, then I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: wenbryant
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Farmer's Daughter on January 16-18, 2007 on our trip back from Australia. It is located directly across the street from the LA Farmer's Market, which is a great, inexpensive place to eat and shop. If you go be sure to make some time. The hotel looks like it was renovated from a 1960's motel to a hip hotel with a bar and restaurant called Tart. The rooms that are across from the courtyard are extremely noisy at night because they face Fairfax Ave. The king size rooms are nice and spacious but, we got moved to a queen size room the second night and were not comfortable. Try to book a room on the opposite side of the hotel. The bar and restaurant are nice but pricey. You'll do better by walking across the street to the Farmer's Market. They have no laundry services and the internet is not free. If you want a place that is centrally located it is good for that but, I would not recommend staying there for a lengthy period.

Reviews.Title: “LA'S Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: jbristol72
Reviews.Content: This hotel "rocks". My friend and I stayed here for two incredible nights. The hotel staff is the best. I have never met so many nice folks. Justin, Marissa, & the manager from TART were great. The front desk staff were superb, meeting all of our many needs. When we arrived it was early morning about 9:00 a.m., and the staff was kind enough to find us an available room. We really felt right a home. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like to sleep in??? Don't come here...”
Reviews.Author: SleepyTime
Reviews.Content: The room was very cute and quite clean. Great location. Having to pay a valet to park your car around the back is a little cheeky, but I suppose nessecary because the hotel and restaurant parking are shared and the restaurant gets quite busy. Also, having to pay for internet is a bit crap as well as most places include this free. The big problem with this place was that the one day of my trip I could sleep in, I well... couldn't. We stayed in the back on the ground level and from very early in the morning there was the constant honking of car horns. At first I couldn't figure out what it was, but I realised the valet was too lazy to identify the car to collect in a way other than pushing the button to lock the car and seeing which one honks. He did this all morning from quite early, he didn't stop after I called the front desk to complain, and he didn't stop when I confronted him. That was one of the worst stays I've had, especially from a place that I had expected to be fabulous. I would never stay here again, nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: No_Real_Deal
Reviews.Content: What you pay for here is location....everything else is secondary. The rooms are very small and designed with a hip yet cheap esthetic(they don't even use curtains that block out the sun light). The hotel is also noisy and seems to attract a lot of very young girls (8-12) who want to visit a doll store at the Grove shopping mall. If you are looking to save a buck and not have a restful night, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky”
Reviews.Author: rosebud9
Reviews.Content: Our group recently stayed at The Farmer's Daughter Hotel and were delighted by several things - the funky, fun nature of the rooms and the hotel grounds; the friendliness of the staff; the good food and service at the hotel restaurant; and the excellent location across the street from The Grove shopping center and delightful Farmer's Market, also just a few blocks from Museum Row and the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and La Brea Tar Pits. We're going back next year. Added bonus: Great price on rooms for a hotel with this location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good buy”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTripper
Reviews.Content: i just spent a week working at the Farmer's Daughter for business and I'd definitely recommend it. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms, lobby, and courtyard are well-designed and decorated, and the location is amazing -- right across the street from the Farmer's Market and the Grove, near a drugstore and a Whole Foods. It's great if you're there on business and don't want to go to a restaurant every day. The only issue I had is that Internet access is not free - $10 for 24 hours or $4 for one hour.

Reviews.Title: “cute, clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: husband/wife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights and had a lovely stay. The staff were very friendly and we enjoyed the restaurant on site "Tart" we ate there four times. The food was wonderful. We took a cab to Hollywood Blvd and it was only $13.00 and spent the day there, a day across the street at the Farmers Market and The Grove shopping and took a day tour of the city and stars homes. That was wonderful. Would stay there again. Don't forget to do the MGM studio tour.That was the highlight of our trip as we rented a car from the Farmer's daughter to go there, then to Malibu then to Santa Monica and that was only $78.00 a day plus $9.00 for gas. All in all the trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “No Pets - bad service”
Reviews.Author: Travelton
Reviews.Content: Apparently, an outside service takes reservations for this hotel and due to some sort of miscommunication the service mistakenly took our reservation with a pet. The hotel refused to honor the it or to arrange for us to go to a different hotel. What was more irritating is that they made sure we didnâ€™t have any written proof they reservation included a pet (we made it via phone) and later with a very straight face commented it had happened several times before because the outside serviceâ€™s mistake. Our observation that the reservation service and the hotel are the same thing for customers like us (we called the number in their web site) didnâ€™t seem to register with the manager. Bottom line, we were stuck in L.A. late afternoon with a large dog and nowhere to go. The hotel staffâ€˜s complete lack of concern or sense of responsibility shows they have no idea what service means. Save yourself a headache and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: garytalky
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids stayed here for 3 nights. This hotel is centraly located from all attractions. We spent lots of time at the Farmers Market and The Grove. Although the room were small and there were only double beds for our family. We enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but noisy”
Reviews.Author: misspipsy
Reviews.Content: It's easy to see why Farmer's Daughter received awards for their design. They turned a 1950s budget motel into something fun and funky. Color, gingham, and farm implements meet a European sensibility. Especially fun juxtaposed to the hipness of LA. Great location, helpful service, with small, clean rooms. The great decor makes you overlook the motel-ness of the rooms. All centered on a couple of levels around an active courtyard. But all the sounds from the courtyard below came up right through the door to my room 24/7. Even on the second level you plainly hear kids shrieking in the pool, the cleaning staff, and other guests through the day. At night you hear the partying. The air conditioner drowned out most noise so I could sleep. One night at 2 a.m. I woke to hear the soul music from the lobby below as if it was playing in my room. My travel companion two doors down was awakened two nights straight by the cleaning crew working and vacuuming outside his room at 3 a.m.! I don't recommend the overpriced upscale restaurant next to the hotel. I don't mind paying more for a nice meal, but neither the portions nor preparation lived up to the menu cost.

Reviews.Title: “Prices Are Up but the Property is Getting Worn Out...”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorGirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Farmer's Daughter for the past few years and are experiencing what I guess can be called a recent "burn out" as the costs rise but the quality does not. This is a converted Motel on a very busy street in Los Angeles but the location makes it a desirable location for contestants on "The Price is Right" as well as visitors who like the proximity to the Grove and Farmer's Market across Fairfax Avenue. There is a good deal of street noise and a busy alley behind the main building faces an auto repair shop that gets banging pretty early. Trash removal by a dumpster service also makes a racket at dawn a few days a week. We always pack ear plugs. Because there are communal areas on the ground floor pool patio and an open air second floor furnished lounge, it is best to request a room away from the action as people meet to chat and smoke and drink into the wee hours. Contestant meetings for the game shows are also held in the lobby in the evenings which makes it rather awkward to use the computer or congregate if you're not on a show. When we visited last year, the room rate was a little more than $100 a night and parking charges had been upped to $10 a night (mandatory valet parking is the only option). Use of wired internet was free in the room and the hotel offered no food service save a coffee pot en suite and a small fridge for anything you might bring to your room. This year, much to our dismay, the rates on the hotel website were closer to $200 a night. After shopping around awhile on the web, we found a $139 weeknight/$149 weekend rate and booked using expedia.com - a service requiring full payment for the entire stay in advance (yikes!). Upon arriving at the motel, we were impressed to see their new restaurant TART had opened and seemed busy with trendy Angelinos. Perhaps because there is increased traffic at the cafe, parking rates were hiked to $12 plus tax/tip and the small valet stand is very busy. Cars were backed up in front and into the driveway which made check in a little difficult. The desk had trouble locating our reservation and we feared there was a miscommunication with the prepaid discount rate or the booking site. The desk staff are always very pleasant and helpful and they worked it out. Once we got to our room, it was pretty much "Same Time Next Year." Nothing changes year in and out in the rooms, but towels, rugs and furniture are definitely showing signs of wear and tear. The bathrooms are original to the motel and have gotten a little dingier with time. Our shower head was damaged and sprayed the entire bathroom each time we used it... These inconveniences are all minor when one is paying around $100 a night, but to be fair - this is not the quality of a $200 hotel room in Los Angeles. Times change and prices rise, but there is stiff competition for moderate hotels in the area and the Farmer's Daughter needs to update their facilities if they expect return guests. Free internet is gone as well. We logged on the first morning and found the service is $10 additional a day. There is a terminal available in the lobby for the same day rate or $4 an hour. We used a small safe in the room to stash valuables. We have never had a problem with articles left in our room. Our stay was just under a week's time in mid-July 2006. Housekeeping came in daily to change the well worn towels and make the bed, but did not change the linens. 2 small blue area rugs on the linoleum floor were never cleaned nor replaced. They were a little dusty all along. Chair cushions and slip covers were spotted and worn and the walls could have used a fresh coat of paint. To be fair, the Farmer's Daughter is quaint and funky and located in the midst of lots of shops, cafes, and the superTrendy Grove Mall. It is easy to walk around to pick up a quick meal at the Farmer's Market, to run to the drug store, or to check out the nearby shops and museums. Be aware that there is an active homeless population on Fairfax and walking alone late at night can be a little daunting. We have always enjoyed the Farmer's Daughter over the years but feel like the facilities could be spruced up as the rates are quickly increasing. The competition at the nearby Elan Modern might just lure us away from the old Farmer's Daughter on our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Danielle75
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Farmer's Daughter for several years now and love it. The rates are reasonable and the location is great. It's in the middle of LA and right across the street from the fabulous Farmer's Market and the Grove. The rooms are spacious and clean. They have free internet access and great bathroom amenities. We haven't visited since they opened their restaurant, TART, but I'm excited to try it. How many other "motels" have on-site restaurants? It IS annoying to pay for valet parking when for most rooms you have to walk through the parking lot anyway but I understand why they have to have it. The lot has fewer spaces than rooms and valet parkers can park cars closer together to save room. Also, they needed to have valet parking in order to get the liquor license for the restaurant. Also, in order to get into the parking lot, you have to go through a gate which closes off the rooms to the street. The valet parkers have some sort of remote that opens and closes the gate. Having the gate there makes me feel safer. We've stayed in the No Tell Room which has a king size bed, a wet bar and a mirror on ceiling. I liked it but found it was a little dark. We've also stayed in their regular rooms. On our next visit, we will stay in a suite because we need more room with our baby daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Greal deal- Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: snicklefrytz
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Myself, my husband and our two kids ages 3 and 10 thought it was nice. The pool....meh, but the cute patio area near the restaurant is really nice, especially at night. The pool is just small and blah. The location is phenomenal- right across from The Grove and the Farmer's Market. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Nothing spectacular- if you want to be wowed there are plenty of places in Los Angeles that can do that for you - but not at this price. For a simple clean place to stay with a friendly staff- choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Come on Down”
Reviews.Author: RKeizur
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay the night before going on The Price is Right, this is the place. Directly across the street from the CBS Bob Barker Studio. This is a very "cute" hotel with some charm. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised! The price was ok for the area and the required Valet parking ($12 +tax). Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: darlingnikki22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Los Angeles for my sister's birthday and decided to stay at The Farmer's Daughter Hotel. Having stayed in many of the other hotels in the area, I can honestly say that this is by far the best value for money and a complete escape from the usual L.A. "vibe". Everything from the edgy design, amazing location and excellent service, to the restaurant discount given to all guests, made this is our new favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: bltbb
Reviews.Content: Our party reserved approximately 10-15 rooms at the Farmers Daughter Motel to attend a wedding over Memorial Day Weekend. Slightly disappointed in the plainness of the hotel, but recovered quickly once we settled in. The rooms were clean, not fancy at all but very efficient. Plenty of storage space for hanging items, toiletries, etc. Our room was two double beds, which were changed every day, not just made up. The motel has wonderful areas which our group could congregate and visit. One morning we all met upstairs in an outside area for coffee and danish. We met down in the lobby/outside area a few times also. We were very impressed with the casual atmosphere we experienced. The bar/restaurant was OK - we never at there but had drinks there the first night. The were very pricy though. Right across the street is CBS Studios, The Grove (wonderful shopping/restaurant area) and the Farmers Market. These places should be visited at least once beacuse of their uniqueness and variety of what they offer. We would definately stay there again. Never used the pool or pool area, but it looked fine. Parking was via valet with a charge of $12 per day with unlimited in and out. The Farmers Daughter Motel was inexpensive based on other hotels in the area and had a really nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently staying at The Farmer's Daughter to visit The American Girl Store with our daughter. The service was wonderful, the staff was very pleasent, and the location is wonderful! The hotel is located in an area referred to as The Grove which contains great shopping and several resturants. We found the Farmer's Daughter to be a great slice of home away from home. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin to discourage people from wasting their time, money and memories on this place? This hotel is disgusting and the service is terrible! We booked reservations in January of 2006 for 2 rooms for 2 nights. We arrived at the hotel on 5/19 at 11:00 a.m. to let the front desk know that we were in town. We were told that rooms were not ready yet, but they did have our reservation. We told them that we were taking my 8 year old niece to American Girl Place and that we would check in at 8:00 p.m. The front desk clerk said "NO PROBLEM". We arrived back at 8:00 p.m. and the front desk clerk stated "You guys are going to hate me but we don't have your rooms. We can upgrade you from your two double beds to a King and a blow-up bed!" Hello, but is this an upgrade to anyone? A blow-up bed? We asked that the manager be called and were told that it was too late to call him (8 pm!) and that he would not be back until Monday. This place -----! There is no customer service and there is no one running the place. It was a dive in every sense of the word! This was the best thing that could have happened to us, as it turned out! We stayed at the Le Montrose Suites on Hammond which is a gorgeous, quiet, wonderful suite hotel. Who should we run into during our stay, but the 12 finalists for American Idol. We met 10 of the 12 and had our own private photo and autograph session. Talk about making an 8 year old's dreams come true! Thank God this dump gave our rooms away..and thank God American Girl Place has removed them from their listing of recommended hotels, so that other people will not have to go through the frustration that we did with them. Check out Le Montrose Suites - the rates are great, the hotel is gorgeous and at night, there are chocolate dipped berries and chocolate chip cookies on your pillows! Thank you for sending in your review. The community appreciates your feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where oh where do I begin? On Friday my two daughters,granddaughter,her grandmother and I(her other grandmther arrived in LA to celebrate my granddaughter's 8th birthday. Her other grandmother made reservations at this hotel. in Janurary. We checked in about 2. Lady at the desk said it was fine to come back later. At 8:30 after a wonderful time at the Grove Shopping Center mainly The American Girl Store we went to the Farmer's Daughter only to be told they had 2 rooms for us with a king bed in each.We made reservations for two double beds and a rollaway bed. She said all the rollway beds were taken but she could give us a blow up bed (what ever that is) We asked to speak to the manager and the woman at the desk said he had gone for the evening and it was way too late to call. It was onlt 8:30. Woman behind the desk said she would call other hotels in an attempt to find us rooms. She never identified herself. when she made the phone calls. In the mean time,my daughter was able to find us other accomodations.The only reason we wanted to stay there was its closeness to the Grove. I guess you could say it was a blessing in disguise as the hotel we stayed at was FABULOUS and because the clerk felt sorry for us he gave us an amazing rate. He said he had been in LA for awhile and had never heard of theFarmer's Daughter.So please think twice, three times before you make reservations here.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: plushbrains
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have been nice when it first opened. Everything was done very cheaply. Cheap being the operative word. The rooms are noisey and dark with few lights. We were supposed to have a suite that slept 4. The second bed was a 2 inch futon couch cusion. When we asked about options they were unhelpful and, frankly, rude. The valet parking adds $20 per day plus tips. The location is OK if you want to go to the Grove shopping mall or the farmers' market. Otherwise, it's not that close to anything. We used to live in LA and still visit it 3-4 times per year. We were very excited to hear about this new place. We got out of there after one night. We were supposed to stay a week. The Sheriton DelFina in Santa Monica was a much better value. I would avoid this place. It's no deal.

Reviews.Title: “i had a great stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Now that I got back from my trip I wanted to write some reviews. The place was so darn cute. the design flowed from the lobby to the rooms. The staff treated us very well, we did have to wait to check in until 3 pm - after a long flight that was a drag. The rooms have real denim bed spreads!! I thought this was just a great idea. I was able to get my email this was a huge plus for me since i am an email junky. They opened up a new restaurant for dinner while we stayed and the food was fantastic. it seemed a little frantic but they did just open so i was going to base it all on the food and the food was perfect. All in all i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be taken in by the cute country chic”
Reviews.Author: tckldpink
Reviews.Content: For concept and style, I give them three stars. But for service, I give them NO stars. I visited with my dog. As I checked in, I was told that I would not be welcomed back with him and that the person that made my reservation would be fired. (Apparently they have a 30 pound limit and the reservationist forgot to tell me this.) The owner/manager made me immediately feel uncomfortable (told me "someone would be fired for this") and sorry for any poor soul who had the misfortune to work for him. The lobby was nice and the new restaurant is wonderful. But the rooms screamed: crusty MOTEL! The mattresses were squeaky and thin. There was chewed gum and hair in my flower pot. Then to top it off my bathtub backed up with the waste water from the room above me every morning when someone took a shower up there. (Check out my photo above.) I reported it every day and it was never fixed. Utterly repulsive. I admit the location is great, the restaurant is tasty, and most of the staff is very helpful and friendly. One night won't kill you but lower your expectations before you get there. I was stuck there for several gruelling days on business, but luckily my next stop was Loews Santa Monica. Nothing like the beach and excellent hospitality - the perfect antidote to a week of stressful, shabby accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! this is a MOTEL, with exterior corridors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: they casually forget to mention to you that this is a 3 story MOTEL with exterior corridors. BEWARE!! the outside looks FAIR, but once you realize where you are - it all starts to fit in. Unfortunately i have done my research too late. this was a RUNDOWN MOTEL infested with drug addicts and such, and redone into a cleaner motel - with a wannabe basic designer look. remember the 60's and 70's roadside motels where you pull your car up straight to the entrance of your room ? well, THIS MOTEL IS EXACTLY THAT. rooms look ok at first, until you start taking a closer look at things. 1970's tiny zenith TV, old , torn/stained/scratched up furniture. Not even a floormat in the bathroom. The only "hotel" item they have is the electronic door lock and pay movies. they advertise wireless ( for which you have to pay), but when you check in, they advise you that you really cant get a wireless signal anywhere in the rooms, because of the way the building is made. what the hell kind of an answer is that? This is a MOTEL to such an extent that even the soda machine in the lobby level says " FARMERS DAUGHTER MOTEL". the machine itself is also from the 70's or ealy 80's - letting you know that noone splurged an extra penny on making this place the best it could be. Yes, they do have a restaurant on property, but the food is,,,,,,,,,,well,,,,, cold, to be polite. i think they pre-made a lot of stuff, and served it heated ( at least to us). We had breakfast and out of 4 omeletts - 2 were stale ( no joke). How in the world do you get a stale omelette. Was it an omelette that a previous patron did not eat? who the ehll knows, but for a NEW restaurant - it is unacceptable. Front desk staff is plain RUDE from the beginning to the end. I knew i was in trouble when i walked in to check-in and observed a big fat man with a big stomach walking around in dirty jeans and a stained blue t-shirt. It ended up to be the manager ( which i suspect is also the owner of this joint). The only good thing about this dump is the location. across the street is a lovely "farmers market" which is more like a small village of shops, cafes and restaurants, that you can stroll around for several hours. Bottom line is: if they were CHEAP, i would understand using them as a last resort, but they are not chepa by far - so my suggestion - look elsewhere. shop the net, call several hotels directly, buttry to avoid this place unless you are desperate and in a total bind, because at times LA just gets this way.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Farmer's Daughter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I couldn't agree more with the review about this less than hip, clean and accomodating hotel and staff. We stayed there to be near our daughter. We arrived mid morning after a tedious flight from China. Our rooms were not ready and under no circustances would the staff help us out. I have been the world over and never were staff as rude and unhelpful as this. The woman at the desk was robotic in repeating when check in time was. There were empty rooms but no go. The manager was mean and uncooperative. P.S. Heating vents were open and television was broken. The pits!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at The Daughter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a quick trip to LA for a family wedding. After much searching for a location near the events we were attending, we decided on Farmers Daughter ... mainly due to the fact that it was a much better price than most of the hotels in LA and it didn't look like a roach motel. For the price, it is a great find. It's a cute, boutique-y hotel. The rooms are clean and very cute (the pictures online don't really do it justice). We booked our room via the hotel's web site directly. From the reviews online and the owners blog, it looks like that is probably the best way to book this hotel. We didn't have any problems and got the lowest price I could find by going direct. Many people seemed to have issues with the parking, but honestly ... EVERYWHERE in LA is valet parking. It's part of the culture there, and probably much more practical for the hotel. It was the cheapest valet parking anywhere around. Not much to really complain about there. And, the valet guys were great. The only downside is that check in was a 4 pm and we arrived very early. Luckily, we had somewhere to go, but some of the other guests were put out. Most places have an earlier check in or will let you check in sooner. We even let them know when we booked that we were arriving early and would appreciate getting checked in early and they still wouldn't let us in earlier than 3 pm. Another minor annoyance was that although it was a non-smoking room, the room smelled terribly of stale smoke. We adapted after a while (and the air is so disgusting in LA that you can't breath anyway so after the first day, I couldn't smell anything). All in all, for the price .. you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter on 4/21 and 4/22. I booked online and the room I got was exactly as described. The location is great - right across from the Farmers Market. The staff was courteous and helpful, valet was convenient and my breakfast at their restaurant (Tart) was delicious. If you like generic hotels with plush carpet, this is not the place for you. But if you want a good value, Farmer's Daughter is clean, conveniently located and imaginative. Loved the "rain" showerhead and the mini-fridge (you can shop at the Farmers Market and keep your food costs down!). Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: floridonna
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Farmer's Daughter because it's across the street from the Farmer's Market. It is such a sweet little hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was knowlededgable as well as helpful. We took a cab from the train station to get there. The taxi was $30 from the train station, cheaper than the super shuttle. Location was good and we were picked up at the hotel for the movie star tour which was booked at the hotel front desk. CBS studios is across the street. Pool is small, but I didn't go to swim. They just opened a new restaurant onsite and although we didn't get a chance to eat there, it looked like a lovely little place to 'chill.' Serves breakfast and lunch. Lots of shopping and food across the street. You won't be disappointed. Stayed for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of The Farmers Daughter”
Reviews.Author: hiyall804
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the recommendations here and its location to the things that we wanted to do while in LA. I booked a 2 night stay with hotels.com (3/21/06-3/23/06). I called back on 3/18/06 to add another night and move our check out date to 3/24/06. I DO have written confirmation from hotels to show I requested and PAID for a 3 night stay 3/21-3/24/06. On Thur 3/23/06 the hotel staff moved our things out of the room (and the room safe that had all of our valuables). The claim they never got the information from hotels.com adding the extra day and they were booked for the night. They did NOT help us find another hotel in LA, they did not show that they were sorry, in fact the manager was mad that she had to take a taxi back to the hotel to unlock the room that they had stored all our belongings in. It was HORRIBLE. It was spring break and several hotels were booked. We drove around for over 3 hours (and we do not know the LA area) before we found a hotel around 12:30 am that had a room (and it was not a good place to stay, I doubt that we slept for more than 1 hour). I had booked a bus tour on Fri 3/24/06 and was due to be picked up from The Farmers Daughter at 8:20 am. Since we were not there we were still billed ($188) as a no-show. I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality in the West”
Reviews.Author: gee2u
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Los Angeles from South Louisiana and expected to not see the southern hospitality we were accustomed to. But, to our surprise, everyone at The Farmer's Daughter's Hotel was more than willing to go out of their way to help us with all our needs. If we had questions, requests or needed directions or recommendations. The staff there was wonderful. The hotel was clean & located in walking distance to dinning & shopping. Convenient off street parking for a reasonable fee with Valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, and cosy but is it a Motel or Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: AndreaHaag
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Farmer's Daughter for a week. I chose this motel/hotel for the location...close to all the places I had to get to. The rooms were very cosy and homey...loved the feeling. But I had serious problems with the noise the flushing toilets made, especially when the room above you is flushing at 3 in the morning. The toilets are the industrial type you'd find in an office building or commercial industrial site. My first night was interrupted by the arguing in the next room over along with the flushing noise. Would I stay again? I don't know. Money spent here was the same as if I were paying a three star hotel but paying for a motel atmosphere. Pluses....room had refrigarator, safe, and wood floors. But needs to provide free internet connections, not pay the 9.95 a day for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a hoot-enay at Farmer's Daughter”
Reviews.Author: WaveKat
Reviews.Content: Really loved this place! Delightfully kitschy and in such a great location. Love all the little touches, from the music to the water-pump-like faucets. All in keeping with the theme Only thing that I can think of that is negative is that the sign on the outside is difficult to see. Drove by about 3 times before I finally saw the Farmer's Daughter logo.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLeia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here while she was looking at colleges in the L.A. area. We really liked the location because, after coming back from our visits around the city, we could relax in our room and then just stroll across the street to the Grove shopping center and the Farmer's Market to eat and look around, which offered really reasonable food with loads of great choices. One evening we met a friend and had wonderful, authetic Cajun dinners for about $15 total! There is also a really good coffee shop in the Grove and places that offer a great breakfast. The hotel itself was very satisfactory. We did want a non-smoking room, but got a smoking one instead, so we had to get used to that lovely, lingering cigarette odor. The guys at the front desk were very nice, except for one who looked down his nose at me when I asked for a pass code to use the wireless Internet. The night before a pass had been given to me without extra charge (you need a new pass code every 24 hours) and when I asked the following night, he looked up my account and said that because I booked through Expedia, we couldn't have free access. I told him that it was included in my room rate and that I had had a free pass code the night before, but he wouldn't budge. I then went up to my room and had to call Expedia customer service to help me, and they confirmed that the Internet was included in my rate. I then had to go back to the guy and tell him what happened, but he said he'd have to check with someone else. When that person came out, luckily he recognized me from the night before and gave me a code. But what an unnecessary hassle! It's unclear about their Internet charges, but it should be free. I also didn't appreciate having to pay $12/day for valet parking -- a real rip off. Our car was parked for us literally three feet away. When we first arrived, I said I could park the car myself but wasn't allowed to. We had to get all of our stuff and get out of the car right away so it could be basically turned into a space that was a couple of feet away from us. Unreal. One of the valet parkers also really gunned my engine and drove it really fast, then screeched it in front us, even though it had only been driven a few feet. I hope they don't expect tips! Overall, we really liked the hotel and the decor. It's hard to get anywhere in LA without driving, so we didn't mind it not being near any typical tourist spots and it's a very short drive to Hollywood and Beverly Hills from there, as well. A very central location for LA. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, unless on the Price Is Right.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter for one day in January 2006 and I was overall unimpressed when I took everything into account. The hotel itself is a nice modern looking building with well equipped bedrooms but it almost is a motel. For almost $200 per night for a standard room, I expected more. The location is good if you are planning on going to CBS Television City because it is located right across the street. Also, the Farmer's Market and an outdoor mall are right across the street. There aren't a lot of things to do within walking distance so I don't suggest you stay for an extended period of time. I would choose another hotel away from this part of LA. LA is beautiful, but this hotel just didn't justify the price and the mandatory $12 per day VALET parking. They insist that they park your car for you even though it's like having someone park your car for you in your own driveway. The complex is small and the parking spots are mostly right outside your front door! The parking is just a money grab and they'll charge your an additional $12 if you keep your vehicle parked while you're at CBS for a taping of a show. The valet parking boys were useless and couldn't speak english. The bedrooms were newly renovated and charming but they lacked a warmness due to the hard floors and extensive use of denim in decorating. The beds were comfortable and clean but the television looks like it was Zenith's original model and looks out of place. The bathroom is tight a dingy and looks like it was taken out of a $19 per night motel. There are few other services available at this hotel and would suggest that it should only be a 1.5 star rating. Overall, I was very disappointed for what I got for my money and do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the location is somewhat convenient, the hotel is roughly 40 years old. Owners have renovated but it still remains a 40 year old exterior entrance hotel. Rates were way to high that hotel. Should be worth about 65 USD...no more than that... No bar, lounge, decent restaurant, limited parking..would recommend staying closer to downtown in upscale hotel for this money!! No frequent flyer miles...nothing!!! Recommend staying with a hotel that has some sort of affiliation so you can get some perks.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: laskrops
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Farmer's Daughter in January 2006. This is the second time we have stayed here in two years. The actual hotel is fine. It has clean rooms and is in a good location. It is directly across the street from the Farmer's Market which has excellent and afforable food (try Loteria taqueria for great breakfasts, lunches and dinners and Mexican coffee). The customer service, however, is sorely lacking. The hotel now has mandatory valet parking which apparently was included in the price of our room. We did not know this when we pulled up and the young valet boy could not articulate this, nor was he assertive enough to do his job. This hotel, really a motel, does not need valet parking, by the way. It is too small, and if your room is in the annex building, you end up having to walk very far with your bags, with no offer of a bell hop service. Anyway, we ended up parking our own car and were rudely chased down by who I assume to be a manager, although, he never introduced himself. He shouted at us that we could not park our car ourselves. We explained that we were not aware of the mandatory valet service and that we asked two of his staff members who could never answer us. He never apologized, and acted poorly overall. We did not feel like guests, but intruders. BTW, this motel uses the term parking to mean valet. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: dingbat
Reviews.Content: The Farmer's Daughter is a newly refurbished motel situated opposite the well known Farmer's Market in LA. Our room was a good size and very clean with a huge bed, tv, dvd. There was a nice outside seating area on the ground floor and also a smaller seating area on our floor where you could chill out, there was also a pool if you fancied a swim. Staff were very helpful, but because of the position of the motel (on a busy main road), it could get quite noisy at times. Apart from the Farmer's Market just across the road, you needed to take a bus to see anything else of LA. Breakfast isn't included in the price of the room, but just to the left of the hotel, there's a great Bagel Shop with a very colorful owner by the name of Bart which we'd highly recommend for breakfast and some entertainment. On the whole, good value for money, but on reflection, we wish we'd gone with our first choice and stayed in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: CFitzO
Reviews.Content: Farmer's Daughter is a motel in a good location. The service we received was rude. We prepaid a month in advance for adjoining rooms so that our young kids could sleep in one room and the grownups could sleep next door with a door joining the two rooms. We called the morning we arrived to ask about the rooms and were assured all would be ready when we arrived. When we arrived they told us they no longer had adjoining rooms. They were not apologetic, would not show us what rooms they did have available, would not help us to find another hotel, and were generally condescending and rude. We have travelled frequently in the US and abroad for the last 15 years and this is the worst hotel staff experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good stay at the Farmer's Daughter”
Reviews.Author: Emmadaisysmum
Reviews.Content: We booked all our hotels for our 2 and a half week trip around California using tripadvisor and I would say that for this hotel as for the others where we stayed that the previous reviews were accurate. Valet parking was fine, check in was efficient but once in our room we realised we had been allocated a smoking room rather than the non-smoking room we had requested. By then we had unpacked and the smell wasn't so bad as to attempt to move but this seems to be an example of the slightly odd customer service style of this hotel. Overall everything seems to run pretty smoothly but the odd thing goes wrong. Another example: we purchased internet access for something trivial like $3.50. On checkout it hadn't been added to our bill, so we pointed this out and paid but when we got home we found they had taken the payment from our credit card again after we had left. Decor of the room and reception was excellent and we loved the location, right opposite the farmer's market. The courtyard was a really pleasant place to relax in and once they have a bar open I'm sure it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Dec 06-10 , rooms are big enough and well decorated, we were on the highest floor, at night we could here some machinery on the roof, besides that everything was great, only bummer, the restaurant is still not open, but lots of places to eat at for breakfast, lunch and dinner, across the street at Farmers Market which is great. also a Savon drug store open 24 hrs 1 block away. I however did not see any famous people like posted on this forum by someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Interesting Hotel but be careful if you want to bring a dog!”
Reviews.Author: superbonbon99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after booking it as a surprise for an anniversary present. My boyfriend and I are both from LA, but just wanted a change of pace for our anniversary weekend. I used to live in the area and always remembered how they had revamped the hotel in recent years. I loved the name (its always stuck out in my head) and jumped on the opportunity to finally spend a night there! One of my favorites about this hotel is the location--across the street from the tasty delights at the Farmer's Market! It was a great treat to wake up and walk over to our favorite crepe stand in the market! It truly was a boutique experience! The hotel itself was clean, fairly modern, and completely cutesy. I was surprised to find a stereo in the room and found the houty-touty LA magazines that were provided great fun! The rocking recliner and portraits of cows and hens were a nice touch! Everything in the hotel is nicely branded as the Farmer's Daughter silhouette could be found everywhere--from the front of the hotel to the notepads in the rooms to the copper elevator interior. The weird part was our bathroom--it was completely plain white, non-descript and didn't have any farmer/country/color theme to it at all (unlike the rest of the hotel.) It seemed a bit unfinished, but it was clean otherwise. After reading reviews where people complained about noise, I was worried. But I have to say it was really really quiet when the windows and doors were closed. My one concern was the reservation system. I had asked for a room that would accommodate a dog when I made the reservation. The woman at the reservation service (a separate service from the actual hotel) told me that it was no problem and that I would just have to tell the front desk. Luckily I confirmed my reservation a few days later just to make sure everything would go smoothly. UNFORTUNATELY, the hotel told me that they only have two rooms that are pet friendly and those are generally booked up way in advance. I was then forced to find a sitter for my boyfriend's dog. It kind of put a kink in my original plans, but was my only gripe with the hotel. I imagine that the main issue is the disconnect with a generic reservation service and the hotel staff. Other than that, I would go back to the Farmer's Daughter!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Principal Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Farmer's Daughter for four nights while visiting our son who is completing a senior year internship in L.A. What a pleasant surprise! Besides having a great location (just across the street from the Farmer's Market and The Grove), the hotel has a wonderful rustic theme that welcomes you the moment you walk in the door. Decorated in "barnyard chic", the rooms have simulated barn plank floors, sink faucets that recreate farm pumps, distressed wood furniture, and whimsical barnyard wallpaper and decorations. The room was clean, the staff was helpful and the price is so reasonable. Once the on-site restaurant is finished by the end of the year, the Farmer's Daughter will have everything for a comprehensive hotel experience. We look forward to returning the next time we are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Modern, Kitschy....a great combination”
Reviews.Author: Pharmgrrrl
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at Farmers Daughter. Was previously here in March 2005. So, i guess the fact that I came back for a 2nd stay says something. We were going to the Price is Right - so we only stayed here one night. You absolutely cannot beat the location if you are going to TPIR. Its directly across the street - which is especially convenient when you're waiting in line at 4:30am. Also, its so close to The Grove / Farmers Market - there are a lot of nice shops and restaurants here...again, just walk across the street. The rooms are decorated in country kitsch theme. Gingham, linoleum hardwoods, etc. Clean and cute. The lobby area is a mix of country flair with modern accents. Very open and breezy. Since we were checking out early - the hotel worked well with us so that we could leave our car there and pay valet, plus check our luggage at the desk and pick up when we finished with TPIR. it all worked out very nicely. Would recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Mellow, quirky, comfy & GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the FD for three nights this week -- it was great! We stayed in a king deluxe room that was funky/chic and roomy...spotlessly clean and perfectly comfy. Check in was easy, the location is fantastic (we had meetings all over LA and it was central to everything), parking was reasonable ($10 a day with in&out), and the staff was nice. The kitschy theme of the hotel is fun and one they're really committed to -- I felt like we were in the next to-be-discovered hot spot in LA. One fascinating quirk of the hotel is Ted, front desk clerk and in-house "The Price is Right!" specialist. If you're around some night at 10:25 p.m., DO NOT MISS his treatise on how to get on TPIR as a contestant. It is a hoot. And it works! The show films at the CBS studios right across the street, so it's a convenient tourist activity for folks at the FD. I suspect they will soon have pilgrimages of people desperate to be contestants who will stay here... There are dozens of pictures in this lobby shrine of all the contestants who have won stuff on it, with his tutelage of course. I might have not believed it, except when we were checking in, a girl was on the phone in the open air lobby (very cool!) telling her mom that she'd just won $7000! Funny, and sweet. The open air lobby was really cool and aesthetically appealing & the pool looked clean and inviting, but it was cool during our visit and not really swimming or hanging outside kind of weather. The only drawbacks to our visit -- and these were minor inconveniences -- were that the free Wifi signal was very weak and spotty in the room, we had better luck in the outdoor seating areas (but as I mentioned, it was kind of chilly). They had a total shut down one day, so perhaps they were working on the system. Also, there was construction happening for a (needed) bar/restaurant on the premises. The banging was kind of a drag, but never before 9 a.m. and we weren't in the room much anyway. Having a restaurant right there would be a perfect addition to this funky cool spot. And the Farmer's Market across the street (and The Grove shopping complex) was just fantastic. We walked over for a number of meals and had great inexpensive food every time. (Oh -- except one morning we went to Cantor's, a 24 hour legendary deli a few blocks north -- an experience, to be sure, but not one I'd ever repeat. Try the Kokomo? Cafe on the South end of the Farmer's Market. KILLER Pancakes and great southern inspired dishes.) Another terrific place is the "Authentic Cafe" on Curson & Fairfax, 1/2 block north and a few blocks west of the hotel...this was a FANTASTIC dinner of south american cuisine -- herbed chicken with rice & beans and plantains, etc -- gorgeous food for a good price, about $60 with wine and tip. We plan on making the FD the place we stay when in LA, which is quite often. It's just great: mellow, quirky, comfy, and in the best location we could imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and found the room to be very comfortable and clean. The shower was excellent. The best thing about the Farmer's Daughter is the location; right across the street from the Farmer's Market and Grove. We did not have a car, so after taking tours during the day, we could just walk across the street for the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Phone calls”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, stayed there for 3 nights nice rooms but was also woken up by phone calls in the middle of the night, from weird people stayig there!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Muk_muk
Reviews.Content: We searched and searched among the cheaper places to stay in the LA / Santa Monica area and finally chose the Farmers Daughter - we were SO pleased when we got there. The staff were really friendly, the hotel looked like something straight out of a design magazine and our room was spacious, well equipped and very clean. Within walking distance are many shops, the Grove outdoor mall (which includes a nice cinema) and the Farmers Market, where you can get the best fresh food around. Within 10 minutes in the car, you can easily be in Beverly Hills / Hollywood tourist areas. Universal Studios are about 20 minutes away by car. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rock on at the Daughter!!”
Reviews.Author: steagnes
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 3 nights in magnificent LA in late May this year. The Farmers Daughter is absolutely perfect for any stay in LA. For a small fee, we were able to park and retreive our car at anytime, the blokes running the Valet were always friendly. The room is a classic in its styling, and very comfortable. The front desk staff were always really friendly. Jonah was a real help with our luggage, storing it for us on our last day, as we had a late night flight home to Sydney. He also dug my new Fender Tele Deluxe that I'd just bought up on Sunset so, good onya Jonah. Its in a great spot, the Daughter, close to Hollywood, Sunset, Melrose and the Farmers Market has heaps of shops. And we also discovered the legendary Canters Deli up the street. We loved it there for breakfast each morning. All I can say is - DO IT AT THE DAUGHTER!!

Reviews.Title: “Get me outta here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the Farmer's Daughter after reading the various reviews posted. Unfortunately my experience didn't live up to my expectations. I agree with previous postings about the location being excellent, (I couldn't agree more), as well as the noise levels from the street and slamming doors being something I could do without. (But what do you do?) My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights and by the first night we were ready to leave. We received an extremely disturbing phone call from within the motel, (caller unknown), and felt like we were in the 'wrong place.' It could have been a freak phone call, or it could be that "Farmer's Daughter" is a code name for something I wasn't aware of when i made the reservations. All I can say is that for the next two nights I slept with one eye open! After the phone call incident it seemed like everything felt weird, and took on a different vibe. It could be that we overreacted, but I wasn't as comfortable in the hotel after that. I hope my experience was just a fluke and that if you stay here in the future you feel more comfortable than I did.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter to treat my best friend out for her birthday. I am from Southern California, so I pretty much know all of the hotels, and surrounding area. This hotel is one of the best I've ever been to. It is cozy, charming, the staff is warm and friendly, and it is not trying too hard to be something it's not. I looovveeeeddd the decor, and it is walking distance to one of the best shopping streets in LA- 3rd,and across the street from Farmer's Market. If you're in LA, I highly recommend Farmer's Daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a gem”
Reviews.Author: beemac70
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this place in any way at all.Cheap,cool and friendly staff.Probably the best place I stayed in during my whole month holiday in the US.Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The best part about my L.A. weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jaea
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored this hotel. The farm theme is beautifully executed (it's more hip than country) and is carried throughout the entire property, ensuring lots of delightful little surprises in the hotel's decor and amenities. Our first-floor pet room with double beds was spacious, CLEAN, nicely decorated, and above all, comfortable. We had lots of stuff, but the tables, shelf space and curtained closet kept our room looking tidy. I thought the ultra firm beds would be a problem, but not one of the four of us complained about them. Besides, the sheets were crisp and white, and the blankets fluffy, which made for a good night's sleep. The courtyard is aesthetically pleasing and a great place to eat your takeout or relax in the morning with a magazine and cup of tea or coffee from the lobby. Every morning, I'd stroll across the street to the charming indoor market and outdoor shopping center while my traveling companions slept past noon. They'd call me when they were ready to hit the sights, and I'd be back at the hotel in five minutes! The free movies, high-end toileries, friendly service, great rates and endless supply of thick towels and hot water all were icing on the cake. I'll never search for another L.A. hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “LA without LALA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have any shot of visiting Los Angeles without the pretentions set forth by many of the otherwise notable Hotel establishments, it is at the Farmers Daughter Hotel. It is truly a rare gem set in the perfect location for those seeking to enjoy Los Angeles without succumbing to demands of "being seen in a bustling scene". I am an LA resident and I can't resist the occassional refuge and ambiance, now and then!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just loved this place. The rooms and hotel were really clean and fresh and were in a great location. The staff were very helpful and the outfits are dinky. We got really good room rates by booking a few months in advance. The hotel is within walking distance to the Tar Pits and the Farmers market and a great shopping and movie complex. I have been recommending this place to family and friends. one downside is that the doors to the rooms slam shut, and this will wake you as soon as other guests start leaving their rooms in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonably Priced!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The sole purpose of our trip to L.A. was to see The Price Is Right and this Hotel was THE PLACE TO STAY! We stayed for a total of 3 nights, and found out this little hotel has big personality. Staff was SO HELPFUL and the location couldn't have been better. Even had a special briefing for those planning on attending the taping of the show the next day, offered every night. Rooms were impressive and extremely clean, however the bed we had was firm. The espn was a huge plus for fiance. We were in a smoking room and there was no trace of stinky stale smoke. Pool area was small, but most vacationers staying in L.A. had other things to do besides swim..... Free movie rental from movie library at the desk was great to unwind to. About 20 minutes away is santa monica beach (depending on traffic), a must if you've got time to spend; parking lots available for about $7.00 not even a block away. Ferris wheel and other rides about a 10 minute walk from parking, great running around the beach. Shopping at the farmers market was okay, and plenty of places to grab a bite to eat, would say the mexican place was great. Walk of fame about 10 minutes away, went on a Tuesday am and didn't have to deal with "traffic on the stars" at all. Shops opened about 10am and were still opened at 11 when we went through at night. Also close to the dodger stadium. We were about 15 - 20 minutes away from the stadium and the aquarium of the pacific. The aquarium was fun and marina offered 45 minute tours for $20.00. Would go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not an hourly hotel any longer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farmer's Daughter for the weekend a few weeks ago in one of their lowest priced rooms. It was very nice. The hotel has a cute theme going on and the location could not be more convenient! We walked over to the Farmer's Market and Grove several times for food and drinks and it was so easy - it made me want to move in! The one drawback was that we had some serious traffic noise in the early morning, and we were on the alley side of the hotel. But that allowed me to get up early and stroll the Grove before the stores opened. By the way, we ate at Loteria Grill at the Farmer's Market for lunch and it was fantastic! Also, check out the Whole Foods across Third - it is one of the most amazing grocery stores I have ever seen. They even have a breakfast bar with eggs, cereal, fruit and the like! They have a million kinds of prepared foods that would make a great picnic or to go meal. Have fun at he Farmer's Daughter and enjoy LA!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to LA to shop and to eat at the best restaurants---this is the place for you. It is very close to some of the trendiest spots in LA. The motel decor is rustic yet modern ---I thought it was very hip. The rooms were super clean---the shower was awesome and the soaps and lotions were great. In our experience, the people who work there were super nicer and really helpful. Truth is---as far as price goes---we paid $129 a night---it was really a steal for LA. I've stayed in many places in LA (chain hotels included) that were not nearly as cute and clean and centrally located and I paid quite a bit more. For this price and location---I'd go back in a snap.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, and hip (in an IKEA sort of way)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived in LA for 4 years, and stayed at the Farmer's Daughter on our recent return trip. We chose it because it's in a great location, and being able to walk across the street to eat at the Farmer's Market is a PLUS that cannot be underestimated. The lobby and lounge area are great, very hip and modern in a relaxed, SoCal sort of way, there are chairs and tables, pillows, nice places to relax in or out of the sun. After staying there, it is apparent to me that most of the money on the hotel was spent on the public areas and the overall appearance of the hotel. The room - I was a bit disappointed. We stayed in the main building, which is a renovated mid-century motel. Overall, I feel that the room amenities could be a bit nicer, considering the thought and nice finishings they put into the public areas of the hotel. I'm not one to be picky about beds, but the mattress was incredibly HARD, like it was the cheapest one they could find. The yellow wooden lattice that serves as a "headboard" of sorts behind the bed had a homemade look to it, was in need of sanding and had a couple nails sticking out of it. The floor has no carpet, just some kind of synthetic "wood" vinyl flooring, which made the room lack warmth. The TV, stereo are cheap brands, not fancy like the shiny brochure and webpage would lead you to believe. And the refrigerator looked like they got it from a garage sale. Bottom line, the hotel, though it looks posh from the street and from the lobby, is posh by no means. As far as the room goes, I can only give credit to the nice rain-shower showerhead and the sweet smelling toiletries that come with the room. Otherwise, it still has a "cheap hotel" feel to it under it all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Laurainc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Farmers Daughter for 2 nights this June. Overall the hotel was fun and had a cute theme throughout. The desk staff was helpful and knowledgable, the valet parking was only 10/night, the Farmers Market and the Grove mall was just across the street as well as Cbs Studios. We ate at Maggiano's Little Italy in The Grove and it was awesome. We also ate at the Farmers Market for breakfast at one of the booths (I think it was called Phil's) so this hotel doesn't need a restaurant you have so many optons right across the street. Our room overlooked a car repair shop which I was a little disappointed about. We were not close to any of the touristy attractions (Mann's, Universal, Sunset Blvd etc...)so if you are looking to be in walking distance or quick driving distance any of those spots this is not the place for you. With traffiic it took us close to 20 min or so by car to get there. We ended up driving there and paying for parking so we can walk around. Next time we visit we will definitely pick a hotel closer than this. I would recommend this hotel to Price is Right fans and people not interested in the "touristy" part of LA. The hotel looks like it doesn't belong, it's next to a bank and auto body with no other hotels around. It's very cute and the people were all friendly but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Girl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with the hotel - its location is great as you are across the street from the Farmer's Market & The Grove. Lots of places to eat and shop. Valet parking very reasonable ($10/night) - Whole Foods one block up the street. Stay on the back side away from Fairfax though as road noise can be horrific. No restaurant but none needed - breakfast in the Farmer's Market is a real treat. Son goes to USC and it is only 20 minutes away via surface roads - avoid interstates. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “i loved the farmers daughter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i thought this was the cutest little place. the rooms were very cozy. the location was great, it is right across from the farmers market. the staff was very helpful. lots of outdoor seating if you want to sit outside and read a book. i will stay there again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the first time, but what happened???”
Reviews.Author: gyoon7
Reviews.Content: My first stay last year was great, the rooms where clean and the staff was very friendly. My girlfriend and I returned again this year looking forward to another great stay, but this time around many things changed for the worst. An unexpected addition was the valet parking, which was ok but many times where not present to greet us, on one occasion I ended up parking the car myself. During our first night the front desk was somewhat clueless about the area, for ex. he did not know the name of the restaurants or movie theater across the street and was not very outgoing on trying to find out. The second day was worse, the bed was not made and toilet was leaking, and after complaining to the front desk, their only response was "the cleaning staff is gone", that's it no apology, and when I asked for one, it was given to me with a really nasty attitude. After complaining to the management about these problems, they where kind enough to discount our stay. I do like the Farmer's Daughter, but unless that unpleasant staff goes, I'm not sure that I will return.

Reviews.Title: “A Retro LA Gem”
Reviews.Author: valmont
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s great to see this retro gems retained and updated for the 21st century. The place is faithful to its roots, a bit camp, a little rockâ€™nâ€™roll and perfectly positioned â€“ right across the road from the Farmers Market and The Grove mall and all the sights to see in the Wilshire district â€“ the tar pits, Petersen Auto Museum, the Ambassador Hotel, the Seinfeld apartment block, and Macarthur Park. Staff were great, friendly and helpful, the rooms were comfortable with some delightful touches like a rocking chair. You may noticed a little traffic noise but with the price and the style it was worth the just the smallest annoyance. Iâ€™ll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat - O”
Reviews.Author: LTKING
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Farmer's Daughter last Saturday night. This place is a trip! The lobby is really cute, with the farm theme. It cracked me up when the clerk emerged from behind the back wearing overalls and a checkered shirt. This hotel appears to have been a converted 50's LA motor/hotel. The way they modernized it with the country/hip theme is quite neat. I loved the picture of the hound on the bedroom wall. Yes, as other reviewers said, there is no view. I didn't go for the view, I went for the location - and it is a good, central location. There is valet parking steps away from the registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is so Hollywood. It really spoke to me. It was great to see how they took this old Cali-style motor-motel and created a hip, boutique lodge. The location was great, close to the Sunset strip and downtown. Not high on frills but big on style.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Great but run like a Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The look is great, a total overhaul has made this a cool alternative hotel. The Hotel is run by the strong arm of Motel rules though, don't ask to leave after 12pm or they will quote the "Rule" that does not allow for a later check out without you paying for another night (I asked for a 1pm check out). The kid at the desk thought calling me dude would make up for it but by the time he rolled his eyes for the third time I was over it. You can dress the Farmer's Daughter up, but you can't run her like a real hotel!

Reviews.Title: “'Come On Down'- show prep great!”
Reviews.Author: JoeFriday
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites mid Jan 2005. CBS security guard recommended when we asked about hotels. We came to LA to go on Price is Right and this is certainly the place to stay if going on that show. Right across the street from where you line up at 4am. One of the hotel desk clerks gives a nightly detailed presentation on how to get picked from the audience and other helpful tips. Our room was clean and fun. Decor is Farmer funky.
